text: And the Lord spoke to Moses in the Wilderness of Sinai in the tent of meeting on the first day of the second month in the second year after they went out from the land of Egypt, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Take the sum of all the congregation of the children of Israel, after their families, by the house of their fathers, with the number of their names, every male by their polls,
speaker: Narrator

text: from twenty years old and upward, all who are able to go out to war in Israel. You and Aaron will number them by their armies.
speaker: Narrator

text: With you there will be a man of every tribe, each one the head of his father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These are the names of the men who will stand with you:
of the tribe of Reuben, Elizur the son of Shedeur;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Simeon, Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Judah, Nahshon the son of Amminadab;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Issachar, Nethanel the son of Zuar;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Zebulun, Eliab the son of Helon;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: of Benjamin, Abidan the son of Gideoni;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Dan, Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Asher, Pagiel the son of Okran;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Gad, Eliasaph the son of Deuel;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Naphtali, Ahira the son of Enan.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the renowned of the congregation, leaders of the tribes of their fathers, heads of thousands in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Aaron took these men who had been mentioned by name,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they assembled all the congregation on the first day of the second month, and they declared their pedigrees according to their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, by their polls.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the Lord commanded Moses, so he numbered them in the Wilderness of Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The children of Reuben, the oldest son of Israel,
by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, by their polls, every male from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: those who were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Reuben, were forty-six thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Of the children of Simeon,
by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, those who were numbered of them, according to the number of the names, by their polls, every male from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: those who were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Simeon, were fifty-nine thousand three hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Of the children of Gad,
by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: those who were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Gad, were forty-five thousand six hundred and fifty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Of the children of Judah,
by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: those who were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Judah, were seventy-four thousand six hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Of the children of Issachar,
by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: those who were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Issachar, were fifty-four thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Of the children of Zebulun,
by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: those who were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Zebulun, were fifty-seven thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Of the children of Joseph,
namely, of the children of Ephraim,
by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: those who were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Ephraim, were forty thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Of the children of Manasseh,
by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: those who were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Manasseh, were thirty-two thousand two hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Of the children of Benjamin,
by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: those who were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Benjamin, were thirty-five thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Of the children of Dan,
by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: those who were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Dan, were sixty-two thousand seven hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Of the children of Asher,
by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: those who were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Asher, were forty-one thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Of the children of Naphtali,
by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: those who were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Naphtali, were fifty-three thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are those who were numbered, which Moses and Aaron numbered, and the leaders of Israel, being twelve men. Each one was for the house of his fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: So were all those who were numbered of the children of Israel, by the house of their fathers, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even all they who were numbered were six hundred and three thousand five hundred and fifty.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Levites after the tribe of their fathers were not numbered among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord had spoken to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Only you will not number the tribe of Levi, nor take the census of them among the children of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: but you will appoint the Levites over the tent of the testimony, and over all its vessels, and over all things that belong to it. They will carry the tabernacle, and all its vessels, and they will minister to it, and will camp around the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the tabernacle sets out, the Levites will take it down, and when the tabernacle is to be set up, the Levites will set it up, and the foreigner that approaches will be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Israel will pitch their tents, every man by his own camp, and every man by his own standard, throughout their armies.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Levites will camp around the tabernacle of the testimony, so there will be no wrath on the congregation of the children of Israel. And the Levites will keep the charge of the tabernacle of the testimony.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the children of Israel did according to all that the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Every man of the children of Israel will camp by his own standard, with the ensign of his father’s house. Facing the tent of meeting they will camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the east side toward the rising of the sun the standard of the camp of Judah will camp throughout their armies, and Nahshon the son of Amminadab will be captain of the children of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: His host, and those who were numbered of them, were seventy-four thousand six hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who camp next to him will be the tribe of Issachar, and Nethanel the son of Zuar will be captain of the children of Issachar.
speaker: Narrator

text: His host, and those who were numbered of them, were fifty-four thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then comes the tribe of Zebulun, and Eliab the son of Helon will be captain of the children of Zebulun.
speaker: Narrator

text: His host, and those who were numbered of them, were fifty-seven thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who were numbered throughout the armies in the camp of Judah were one hundred and eighty-six thousand four hundred. They will march out first.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the south side will be the standard of the camp of Reuben according to their armies, and the captain of the children of Reuben will be Elizur the son of Shedeur.
speaker: Narrator

text: His host, and those who were numbered of them, were forty-six thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who camp by him will be the tribe of Simeon, and the captain of the children of Simeon will be Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
speaker: Narrator

text: His host, and those who were numbered of them, were fifty-nine thousand three hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then comes the tribe of Gad, and the captain of the sons of Gad will be Eliasaph the son of Reuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: His host, and those who were numbered of them, were forty-five thousand six hundred and fifty.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who were numbered in the camp of Reuben were one hundred and fifty-one thousand four hundred and fifty, throughout their armies. And they will set out in the second rank.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the tent of meeting will set out with the camp of the Levites in the middle of the camp. As they camp, so they will set out, every man in his place by their standards.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the west side will be the standard of the camp of Ephraim according to their armies, and the captain of the sons of Ephraim will be Elishama the son of Ammihud.
speaker: Narrator

text: His host, and those who were numbered of them, were forty thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: By him will be the tribe of Manasseh, and the captain of the children of Manasseh will be Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.
speaker: Narrator

text: His host, and those who were numbered of them, were thirty-two thousand two hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then comes the tribe of Benjamin, and the captain of the sons of Benjamin will be Abidan the son of Gideoni.
speaker: Narrator

text: His host, and those who were numbered of them, were thirty-five thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who were numbered of the camp of Ephraim were one hundred and eight thousand one hundred, throughout their armies. And they will go out in the third rank.
speaker: Narrator

text: The standard of the camp of Dan will be on the north side by their armies, and the captain of the children of Dan will be Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
speaker: Narrator

text: His host, and those who were numbered of them, were sixty-two thousand seven hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who camp by him will be the tribe of Asher, and the captain of the children of Asher will be Pagiel the son of Okran.
speaker: Narrator

text: His host, and those who were numbered of them, were forty-one thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the tribe of Naphtali, and the captain of the children of Naphtali will be Ahira the son of Enan.
speaker: Narrator

text: His host, and those who were numbered of them, were fifty-three thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: All they who were numbered in the camp of Dan were one hundred and fifty-seven thousand six hundred. They will set out in the back with their standards.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are those who were numbered of the children of Israel by the house of their fathers. All those who were numbered of the camps throughout their hosts were six hundred and three thousand five hundred and fifty.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Levites were not numbered among the children of Israel, as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Israel did according to all that the Lord commanded Moses. So they camped by their standards, and so they set out, each one after his family, according to their fathers’ houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: These also are the generations of Aaron and Moses in the day that the Lord spoke with Moses in Mount Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the sons of Aaron: Nadab the firstborn, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the sons of Aaron, the priests who were anointed, whom he consecrated to minister as priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nadab and Abihu died before the Lord when they brought strange fire before the Lord in the Wilderness of Sinai, and they had no children, and Eleazar and Ithamar ministered as priests in the sight of Aaron their father.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring the tribe of Levi near, and present them before Aaron the priest, and they will minister to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will keep his directives, and serve the whole congregation before the tent of meeting, to do the service of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will keep all the instruments of the tent of meeting, and attend to the needs of the children of Israel, to do the service of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will give the Levites to Aaron and to his sons. They are wholly given to him from the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will appoint Aaron and his sons, and they will attend to their priesthood, and the foreigner that approaches will be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: I Myself have taken the Levites from among the children of Israel instead of all the firstborn that open the womb among the children of Israel. Therefore the Levites will be Mine
speaker: Narrator

text: because all the firstborn are Mine, for on the day that I struck all the firstborn in the land of Egypt I set apart to Me all the firstborn in Israel, both man and beast. They will be Mine. I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses in the Wilderness of Sinai, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Number the children of Levi after the house of their fathers, by their families. You will number every male from a month old and older.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses numbered them according to the word of the Lord, as he was commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These were the sons of Levi by their names:
Gershon, and Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These are the names of the sons of Gershon by their families:
Libni and Shimei;
speaker: Narrator

text:
the sons of Kohath by their families:
Amram, and Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel;
speaker: Narrator

text:
the sons of Merari by their families:
Mahli and Mushi.
These are the families of the Levites according to the house of their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Gershon was the family of the Libnites and the family of the Shimeites. These are the families of the Gershonites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were numbered of them, according to the number of all the males, from a month old and older, those who were numbered of them were seven thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The families of the Gershonites were to camp behind the west side of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief of the house of the father of the Gershonites was Eliasaph the son of Lael.
speaker: Narrator

text: The charge of the sons of Gershon in the tent of meeting included the tabernacle, and the tent, its covering, and the hanging for the door of the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: the hangings of the court, the curtain for the opening of the court that is around the tabernacle and the altar, and its cords—all the service pertaining to these.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Kohath was the family of the Amramites, and the family of the Izharites, and the family of the Hebronites, and the family of the Uzzielites. These are the families of the Kohathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The number of all the males, from a month old and older, were eight thousand six hundred, keeping the guard of the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: The families of the sons of Kohath were to camp on the south side of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief of the house of the father of the families of the Kohathites was Elizaphan the son of Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their duty included the ark, and the table, and the lampstand, and the altars, and the vessels of the sanctuary they minister with, and the hanging, and all its service.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest was to be chief over the leaders of the Levites and to have the oversight of those who kept the guard of the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Merari was the family of the Mahlites and the family of the Mushites. These are the families of Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were numbered of them, according to the number of all the males from a month old and older, were six thousand two hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief of the house of the father of the families of Merari was Zuriel the son of Abihail. These were to camp on the north side of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Under the oversight and guard of the sons of Merari were the frames of the tabernacle, the bars, the pillars, the sockets, all their accessories, all the service pertaining to these,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the pillars of the court all around, with their sockets, and pins, and cords.
speaker: Narrator

text: But those who were to camp before the tabernacle toward the east, even before the tent of meeting on the east side, were Moses, and Aaron and his sons, keeping the guard of the sanctuary for the guard of the children of Israel, and the foreigner who approached was to be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who were numbered of the Levites, which Moses and Aaron numbered at the commandment of the Lord, throughout their families, all the males from a month old and older, were twenty-two thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses: Number all the firstborn of the males of the children of Israel from a month old and older and take the number of their names.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will take the Levites for Me (I am the Lord) instead of all the firstborn among the children of Israel, and the livestock of the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the livestock of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses numbered, as the Lord commanded him, all the firstborn among the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the firstborn males, by the number of names, from a month old and upward, of those who were numbered of them, were twenty-two thousand two hundred and seventy-three.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Take the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the children of Israel, and the livestock of the Levites instead of their livestock, and the Levites will be Mine. I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those who are to be redeemed of the two hundred and seventy-three of the firstborn of the children of Israel, which are more than the Levites,
speaker: Narrator

text: you will take five shekels apiece by the poll; according to the shekel of the sanctuary you will take them (the shekel is twenty gerahs).
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will give the money, by which the number of them is to be redeemed, to Aaron and to his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses took the redemption money of those who were over and above those who were redeemed by the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the firstborn of the children of Israel he took the money, one thousand three hundred and sixty-five shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses gave the money of those who were redeemed to Aaron and to his sons, according to the word of the Lord, as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Take the sum of the sons of Kohath from among the sons of Levi, after their families, by the house of their fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old and older, even to fifty years old, all that enter into the host, to do the work in the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: This will be the service of the sons of Kohath in the tent of meeting, concerning the holiest things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the camp sets out, Aaron will come, and his sons, and they will take down the covering curtain, and cover the ark of the testimony with it,
speaker: Narrator

text: and will put on it the covering of porpoise skins, and will spread over it a cloth completely of blue, and will put in its poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Upon the table of showbread they will spread a cloth of blue, and put the dishes on it, and the spoons, and the bowls, and covers to cover it, and the showbread will be on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they will spread on them a cloth of scarlet, and cover the same with a covering of porpoise skins, and will put in its poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will take a cloth of blue, and cover the lampstand of the light, and its lamps, and its tongs, and its snuff dishes, and all its oil vessels, with which they minister to it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they will put it and all its vessels within a covering of porpoise skins and will put it on a carrying pole.
speaker: Narrator

text: Upon the golden altar they will spread a cloth of blue, and cover it with a covering of porpoise skins, and will put in its poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they will take all the instruments of ministry, with which they minister in the sanctuary, and put them in a cloth of blue, and cover them with a covering of porpoise skins, and will put them on a carrying pole.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they will take away the ashes from the altar and spread a purple cloth on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall put on it all the instruments with which they minister there, the censers, the flesh hooks, the shovels, the basins, all the utensils of the altar. And they will spread on it a covering of porpoise skins and insert its poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary, and all the instruments of the sanctuary, as the camp is to set out, after that, the sons of Kohath will come to carry it. But they will not touch any holy thing, lest they die. These things are the burden of the sons of Kohath in the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the office of Eleazar, Aaron the priest’s son, pertains the oil for the light, and the sweet incense, and the daily grain offering, and the anointing oil, and the oversight of all the tabernacle, and of all that is in it, in the sanctuary, and in the instruments thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not cut the tribe of the families of the Kohathites from among the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: But do this to them, that they may live and not die, when they approach the most holy things. Aaron and his sons will go in, and appoint each one to his service and to his burden.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they will not go in to see when the holy things are covered, lest they die.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Take also the sum of the sons of Gershon, throughout the houses of their fathers, by their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: From thirty years old and older to fifty years old you will number them, all that enter in to perform the service, to do the work in the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the service of the families of the Gershonites, to serve, and to work.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they will carry the curtains of the tabernacle, and the tent of meeting, its covering, and the covering of the porpoise skins that is on it, and the hanging for the door of the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the hangings of the courtyard, and the hanging for the opening of the gate of the courtyard, which is by the tabernacle and by the altar all around, and their cords, and all the instruments of their service, and all that is made for them. So they will serve.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the appointment of Aaron and his sons will be all the service of the sons of the Gershonites, in all their burdens, and in all their service. And you shall assign to them all their tasks as their duty.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the service of the families of the sons of Gershon in the tent of meeting. And their charge will be under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the sons of Merari, you will number them by their families, by the house of their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: From thirty years old and older, even to fifty years old, you will number them, everyone who enters into the service, to do the work of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the charge of their burden, according to all their service in the tent of meeting. The boards of the tabernacle, and its bars thereof, and its pillars, and its sockets,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the pillars of the court round about, and their sockets, and their pins, and their cords, with all their instruments, and with all their service, and by name you will list the instruments of the charge of their burden.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the service of the families of the sons of Merari, according to all their service, in the tent of meeting, under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses, Aaron, and the leaders of the congregation numbered the sons of the Kohathites by their families, and by the house of their fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old and older to fifty years old, everyone who entered into the service, for the work in the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those who were numbered by their families were two thousand seven hundred and fifty.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the ones listed of the families of the Kohathites, all who might do service in the tent of meeting, which Moses and Aaron numbered according to the commandment of the Lord by the hand of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were numbered of the sons of Gershon, throughout their families, and by the house of their fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old and older to fifty years old, everyone who entered into the service, for the work in the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: even those who were numbered of them, throughout their families, by the house of their fathers, were two thousand six hundred and thirty.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the ones listed by the families of the sons of Gershon, of all who might do service in the tent of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the commandment of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were numbered of the families of the sons of Merari, throughout their families, by the house of their fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old and older to fifty years old, everyone who entered into the service, for the work in the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: even those who were numbered by their families, were three thousand two hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the ones listed of the families of the sons of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the word of the Lord by the hand of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those who were numbered of the Levites, whom Moses, Aaron, and the leaders of Israel numbered, by their families, and by the house of their fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old and older to fifty years old, everyone who came to do the service of the ministry, and the service of the work in the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: even those who were numbered were eight thousand five hundred and eighty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
According to the commandment of the Lord they were numbered by the hand of Moses, each according to his service, and according to his burden.
Thus they were numbered by him, as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Command the children of Israel that they put out of the camp every leper, and everyone who has a discharge, and whoever is defiled by the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Both male and female you will put out. You will put them outside the camp, so they do not defile their camps in the midst of which I dwell.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Israel did so, and put them outside the camp. As the Lord spoke to Moses, so the children of Israel did.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell the children of Israel: When a man or woman commits any sin against another, acting unfaithfully against the Lord, that person is guilty,
speaker: Narrator

text: and shall confess his sin which he has committed, and he will repay his offense with its principal, and add to it one-fifth, and give it to him who was wronged.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the man has no relative to repay the offense to, let the offense be repaid to the Lord, even to the priest, beside the ram of the atonement, whereby an atonement will be made for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every offering of all the holy things of the children of Israel, which they bring to the priest, will be his.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every man’s holy things will be his. Whatever any man gives the priest, it will be his.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak to the children of Israel and say to them: If any man’s wife goes astray, and acts treacherously against him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and a man lies with her carnally, and it is hidden from the eyes of her husband, and it is concealed though she has defiled herself, and there is no witness against her, nor is she caught in the act,
speaker: Narrator

text: and if the spirit of jealousy comes on him, and he is jealous of his wife who has defiled herself, or if the spirit of jealousy comes on him and he is jealous of his wife, though she has not defiled herself,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the man shall bring his wife to the priest and he shall bring her offering for her, a tenth of an ephah of barley flour. He shall pour no oil on it nor put frankincense on it, for it is a grain offering of jealousy, a grain offering of remembrance, bringing iniquity to remembrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest will bring her near, and set her before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priest will take holy water in an earthen vessel, and the priest will take some of the dust that is on the floor of the tabernacle and put it into the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priest will set the woman before the Lord, and uncover the woman’s head, and put the memorial offering in her hands, which is the grain offering of jealousy, and the priest will have in his hand the bitter water that causes the curse.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priest will charge her by an oath, and say to the woman, “If no man has lain with you, and if you have not gone astray to impurity with another instead of your husband, be free from this bitter water that causes the curse.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you have gone astray to another instead of your husband, and if you are defiled, and a man besides your husband has lain with you”—
speaker: Narrator

text: then the priest will charge the woman with an oath of cursing, and the priest will say to the woman, “The Lord make you a curse and an oath among your people, when the Lord makes your thigh rot and your belly swell.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And this water that causes the curse will go into your bowels, to make your belly swell and your thigh rot.”
And the woman will say, “Amen, amen.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest will write these curses in a book, and he will wash them out with the bitter water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he will cause the woman to drink the bitter water that causes the curse. And the water that causes the curse will enter into her and become bitter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priest will take the grain offering of jealousy out of the woman’s hand and will wave the offering before the Lord and offer it on the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priest will take a handful of the offering, the memorial portion, and burn it on the altar, and afterward will cause the woman to drink the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he has made her to drink the water, then it will be that, if she is defiled and has acted treacherously against her husband, the water that causes the curse will enter into her, and become bitter, and her belly will swell, and her thigh will rot, and the woman will be a curse among her people.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the woman is not defiled, but is clean, then she will be free and will conceive offspring.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the law of jealousies, when a wife goes astray to another instead of her husband, and is defiled,
speaker: Narrator

text: or when the spirit of jealousy comes on him, and he is jealous over his wife, and will set the woman before the Lord, and the priest will perform on her all this law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the man will be guiltless from iniquity, and this woman will bear her iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak to the children of Israel and say to them: When either a man or woman will make a hard vow, the vow of a Nazirite, to separate themselves to the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: he will separate himself from wine and strong drink and will drink no vinegar of wine, or vinegar of strong drink. Neither shall he drink any juice of grapes, nor eat fresh or dry grapes.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the days of his separation he will eat nothing that is made of the grapevine, from the seed to the skin.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the days of the vow of his separation no razor will come on his head until the days are fulfilled in which he separates himself to the Lord. He will be holy and will let the locks of the hair of his head grow.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the days that he separates himself to the Lord he will not approach a dead body.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will not defile himself for his father or for his mother, for his brother or for his sister if they die because the separation of his God is on his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the days of his separation he is holy to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any man dies very suddenly beside him, and he has defiled his consecrated head, then he will shave his head in the day of his cleansing, on the seventh day will he shave it.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the eighth day he will bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest, to the door of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priest will offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering and make an atonement for him, since he sinned because of the dead, and will sanctify his head that same day.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will consecrate to the Lord the days of his separation and bring a male lamb in its first year as a guilt offering. But the previous days will be lost because his separation was defiled.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the law of the Nazirite. When the days of his separation are fulfilled, he will be brought to the door of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he will offer his offering to the Lord, one male lamb a year old without blemish as a burnt offering, one ewe lamb a year old without blemish as a sin offering, one ram without blemish as a peace offering,
speaker: Narrator

text: a basket of unleavened bread, loaves of fine flour mixed with oil, unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and their grain offering with their drink offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest will bring them before the Lord and will offer his sin offering and his burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he will offer the ram as a sacrifice of a peace offering to the Lord with the basket of unleavened bread. The priest will offer also his grain offering and his drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Nazirite will shave his consecrated head at the door of the tent of meeting, and will take the hair from his consecrated head and put it in the fire which is under the sacrifice of the peace offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest will take the cooked shoulder of the ram, and one unleavened cake out of the basket, and one unleavened wafer and will put them on the hands of the Nazirite, after he has shaved his consecrated hair.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priest will wave them as a wave offering before the Lord. This is holy for the priest, with the breast waved and the shoulder offered. And after that the Nazirite may drink wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the law of the Nazirite who has vowed to the Lord, his offering for his separation, besides whatever else his hand is able to provide. According to the vow which he spoke, so he must do, according to the law of his separation.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak to Aaron and to his sons, saying, This is how you will bless the children of Israel, saying to them,
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord bless you
    and keep you;
speaker: Narrator

text:
the Lord make His face to shine upon you,
    and be gracious unto you;
speaker: Narrator

text:
the Lord lift His countenance upon you,
    and give you peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will put My name upon the children of Israel, and I will bless them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was on the day that Moses had fully set up the tabernacle and anointed it and sanctified it and all its instruments, both the altar and all its vessels, and anointed them, and sanctified them,
speaker: Narrator

text: that the leaders of Israel, heads of their fathers’ houses, who were the leaders of the tribes, and were over them who were counted, made an offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they brought their offering before the Lord, six covered wagons, and twelve oxen, a wagon for two of the leaders, and for each one an ox. And they brought them before the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Accept these things from them, that they may be used in the service of the tent of meeting. Give them to the Levites, to each man according to his service.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses took the wagons and the oxen and gave them to the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Two wagons and four oxen he gave to the sons of Gershon, according to their service.
speaker: Narrator

text: And four wagons and eight oxen he gave to the sons of Merari, according to their service, under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to the sons of Kohath he gave none because the service of the sanctuary belonging to them was that they should carry on their shoulders.
speaker: Narrator

text: The leaders brought their dedication offerings when the altar was anointed, and offered their offerings before the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses: They will offer their offering, each leader on his day, for the dedicating of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that offered his offering the first day was Nahshon the son of Amminadab, of the tribe of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his offering was one silver charger, the weight of which was one hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
speaker: Narrator

text: one spoon of ten shekels of gold, full of incense;
speaker: Narrator

text: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year as a burnt offering;
speaker: Narrator

text: one goat kid as a sin offering;
speaker: Narrator

text: and as a sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the second day Nethanel the son of Zuar, leader of Issachar, presented an offering.

speaker: Narrator

text: This was the dedication of the altar, in the day when it was anointed, by the leaders of Israel: twelve silver plates, twelve silver bowls, and twelve gold spoons,
speaker: Narrator

text: each silver plate weighing one hundred and thirty shekels, each bowl seventy. All the silver vessels weighed two thousand four hundred shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gold spoons were twelve, full of incense, weighing ten shekels apiece, according to the shekel of the sanctuary. All the gold of the spoons was one hundred and twenty shekels.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the oxen for the burnt offering were twelve bulls, twelve rams, twelve male lambs in their first year, with their grain offering, and twelve goat kids for a sin offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the oxen for the sacrifice of the peace offerings were twenty-four bulls, the rams sixty, the goats sixty, the one-year-old lambs sixty. This was the dedication of the altar after it was anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then Moses went into the tent of meeting to speak with Him, and he heard the voice of One speaking to him from the mercy seat that was on the ark of the testimony, from between the two cherubim, and He spoke to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak to Aaron and say to him: When you set up the lamps, the seven lamps will give light before the lampstand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron did so. He lit the lamps before the lampstand, as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this was the work of the lampstand: hammered gold, to its shaft, to its flowers was beaten work. According to the pattern which the Lord had shown Moses, so he made the lampstand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Take the Levites from among the children of Israel and cleanse them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus you will do to them to cleanse them: Splash purifying water on them, and let them shave their whole body, and let them wash their clothes, and so make themselves clean.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then let them take a young bull with its grain offering, also fine flour mixed with oil, and you will take another young bull as a sin offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will bring the Levites before the tent of meeting. And you will gather the whole assembly of the children of Israel together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will bring the Levites before the Lord. And the children of Israel will put their hands on the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron will offer the Levites before the Lord as a wave offering of the children of Israel, that they may do the service of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites will lay their hands on the heads of the bulls, and you will offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering to the Lord, to make an atonement for the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will set the Levites before Aaron and before his sons, and offer them as a wave offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus will you separate the Levites from among the children of Israel, and the Levites will be Mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterwards the Levites will go in to do the service of the tent of meeting, and you will cleanse them and offer them as a wave offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they are completely set aside for Me by the children of Israel. Instead of all who open the womb, instead of the firstborn of all the children of Israel, I have taken them for Myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the firstborn of the children of Israel are Mine, both man and animal. On the day that I struck every firstborn in the land of Egypt I sanctified them for Myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have taken the Levites instead of all the firstborn of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and to his sons from among the children of Israel, to serve the service of the children of Israel in the tent of meeting and to make an atonement for the children of Israel, so there will be no plague among the children of Israel when the children of Israel approach the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Aaron and all the congregation of the children of Israel did to the Levites; according to all that the Lord commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so the children of Israel did to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites cleansed themselves from sin, and they washed their clothes, and Aaron offered them as a wave offering before the Lord, and Aaron made an atonement for them to cleanse them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after that the Levites went in to do their service in the tent of meeting before Aaron and before his sons. As the Lord had commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so they did to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what belongs to the Levites: From twenty-five years old and older they will go in to do their duty concerning the service of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from the age of fifty years they will cease doing their duty concerning its service and will serve no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they will minister with their brothers in the tent of meeting, to attend to their needs, but will not do the work. Thus you will do to the Levites concerning their duties.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses in the Wilderness of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they came out of the land of Egypt, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the children of Israel also keep the Passover at its appointed time.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the fourteenth day of this month, at evening, you will keep it at its appointed time. According to all its rites and according to all its ceremonies, you will keep it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses spoke to the children of Israel, that they should keep the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: They kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month at evening in the Wilderness of Sinai. According to all that the Lord commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were men who were unclean by the dead body of a man, so they could not keep the Passover on that day, and they came before Moses and before Aaron on that day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those men said to him, “We are defiled by the dead body of a man. Why are we kept back, that we may not offer an offering of the Lord at its appointed time among the children of Israel?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said to them, “Stand still, and I will hear what the Lord will command concerning you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak to the children of Israel, saying: If any man of you or of your posterity is unclean because of a dead body, or is far off on a journey, he will still keep the Passover to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fourteenth day of the second month at evening they will keep it, and eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will leave none of it until the morning, nor break any of its bones. According to all the ordinances of the Passover they will keep it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the man who is ceremonially clean, and is not on a journey, and fails to keep the Passover, even the same person will be cut off from his people. Because he did not bring the offering of the Lord at its appointed time, that man will bear his sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a stranger will sojourn among you and will keep the Passover to the Lord, according to the ordinance of the Passover, and according to the manner of it, so he will do. You will have one ordinance both for the resident alien and for the natural born citizen of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the day that the tabernacle was erected, the cloud covered the tabernacle, the tent of the testimony, and at evening there was over the tabernacle the appearance of fire until the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: So it was always. The cloud covered it by day, and the appearance of fire by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the cloud was lifted up from over the tabernacle, then after it the children of Israel journeyed, and in the place where the cloud settled, there the children of Israel camped.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the commandment of the Lord the children of Israel journeyed, and at the commandment of the Lord they camped. As long as the cloud dwelt over the tabernacle they camped.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the cloud remained many days over the tabernacle, then the children of Israel kept the charge of the Lord and did not journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the cloud remained a few days over the tabernacle, according to the commandment of the Lord they dwelt in their tents, and according to the commandment of the Lord they journeyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the cloud dwelt from evening until morning and the cloud was lifted up in the morning, then they journeyed. Whether it was by day or by night that the cloud was lifted up, they journeyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whether it was two days, or a month, or a long time that the cloud dwelt over the tabernacle, the children of Israel dwelt in their tents and did not journey. But when it was lifted up they journeyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the command of the Lord they camped, and at the command of the Lord they journeyed. They kept the charge of the Lord at the command of the Lord by the hand of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Make for yourself two silver trumpets. Of a hammered work you will make them, and you will use them for summoning of the assembly and directing the breaking up of the camps.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they blow both of them, all the assembly will assemble themselves to you at the door of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: If they blow only one, then the leaders, who are heads of the thousands of Israel, will gather themselves to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you blow an alarm, then the camps that lie on the east will set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you blow an alarm the second time, then the camps that lie on the south will set out. They will blow an alarm for their setting out.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the assembly is to be gathered together, you will blow, but you will not sound an alarm.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Aaron, the priests, will blow the trumpets, and they will be to you as an ordinance forever throughout your generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if you go to war in your land against the enemy that oppresses you, then you will blow an alarm with the trumpets, and you will be remembered before the Lord your God, and you will be saved from your enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also in the day of your gladness, and at your appointed days, and in the beginnings of your months, you shall blow the trumpets over your burnt offerings, and over the sacrifices of your peace offerings that they may be a memorial for you before your God. I am the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was on the twentieth day of the second month, in the second year, that the cloud was lifted up from over the tabernacle of the testimony.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Israel set out from the Wilderness of Sinai. And the cloud dwelt in the Wilderness of Paran.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they set out for the first time at the command of the Lord by the hand of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the standard of the camp of the sons of Judah set out first by their armies, and over his armies was Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the armies of the tribe of the children of Issachar was Nethanel the son of Zuar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the armies of the tribe of the children of Zebulun was Eliab the son of Helon.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tabernacle was taken down, and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari set out, carrying the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: The standard of the camp of Reuben set out by their armies, and over his armies was Elizur the son of Shedeur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the armies of the tribe of the children of Simeon was Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the armies of the tribe of the children of Gad was Eliasaph the son of Deuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Kohathites set out, carrying the sanctuary, and they set up the tabernacle before they came.
speaker: Narrator

text: The standard of the camp of the children of Ephraim set out by their armies, and over his armies was Elishama the son of Ammihud.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the armies of the tribe of the children of Manasseh was Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the armies of the tribe of the children of Benjamin was Abidan the son of Gideoni.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the standard of the camp of the children of Dan set out, which was the rear guard of all the camps by their armies, and over his armies was Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the armies of the tribe of the children of Asher was Pagiel the son of Okran.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the armies of the tribe of the children of Naphtali was Ahira the son of Enan.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the order of march of the children of Israel, company by company, when they set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to Hobab, the son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses’ father-in-law, “We are setting out to the place of which the Lord said, ‘I will give it to you.’ Come with us, and we will do good to you because the Lord has spoken good concerning Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Hobab said to him, “I will not go. But I will depart to my own land, and to my kindred.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses said, “Please do not leave us, because you know where to camp in the wilderness, and you may be our eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, if you go with us, then it will be that whatever good the Lord will do for us, we will likewise do for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out three days from the mountain of the Lord, and the ark of the covenant of the Lord went before them the three days’ journey, to find a resting place for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the cloud of the Lord was over them by day when they set out from of the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And it was, when the ark set out, that Moses said,
“Rise up, O Lord,
    and let Your enemies be scattered,
    and let them that hate You flee before You.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And when it rested, he said,
“Return, O Lord,
    to the multitude of thousands of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the people complained openly before the Lord, the Lord heard, and His anger burned. Then the fire of the Lord burned among them and consumed the outskirts of the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people cried out to Moses, and Moses prayed to the Lord, and the fire was quenched.
speaker: Narrator

text: He called the name of the place Taberah because the fire of the Lord burned among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mixed multitude that was among them lusted, and the children of Israel wept again and said, “Who will give us meat to eat?
speaker: Narrator

text: We remember the fish, which we ate in Egypt for free, the cucumbers, and the melons, and the leeks, and the onions, and the garlic.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now our life is dried up. There is nothing at all except this manna before our eyes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The manna was as coriander seed, and it looked like bdellium.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people went about and gathered it, and ground it in mills or beat it in a mortar, and boiled it in pots, and made cakes of it, and the taste of it was like the taste of cakes baked in oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the dew fell on the camp at night, the manna fell on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses heard the people weep throughout their families, every man in the opening of his tent, and the anger of the Lord burned greatly. Moses was also displeased.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to the Lord, “Why have You hurt Your servant? And why have I not found favor in Your eyes, that You lay the burden of all this people on me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Have I conceived all this people? Have I given them birth, that You should say to me, ‘Carry them in your bosom, as a nurse bears the nursing child,’ to the land which You swore to their fathers?
speaker: Narrator

text: Where am I to get meat to give to all these people? For they weep to me, saying, ‘Give us meat, that we may eat.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I am not able to bear all these people alone, because the burden is too heavy for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If You do this to me, please kill me at once, if I have found favor in Your eyes, and do not let me see my misery.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Gather to Me seventy men of the elders of Israel, whom you know to be the elders of the people, and officers over them, and bring them to the tent of meeting, that they may take a stand there with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will come down, and I will speak with you there, and I will take of the Spirit which is on you and will put it on them, and they will bear the burden of the people with you, and you will not bear it by yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And say to the people: Consecrate yourselves for tomorrow, and you shall eat meat, for you have wept in the hearing of the Lord, saying, ‘Who will give us meat to eat? For it was better for us in Egypt.’ Therefore the Lord will give you meat, and you shall eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall eat, not one day, or two days, or five days, or ten days, or twenty days,
speaker: Narrator

text: but a whole month, until it comes out at your nostrils, and it will be nauseating to you because you rejected the Lord who is among you and have wept before Him, saying, ‘Why did we come out of Egypt?’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said, “The people I am with number six hundred thousand foot soldiers, and You have said, ‘I will give them meat that they may eat a whole month.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Will the flocks and the herds be slaughtered for them, to satisfy them? Or will all the fish of the sea be gathered together for them, to satisfy them?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to Moses, “Is the hand of the Lord shortened? Now you will see if My word will happen to you or not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses went out, and he spoke to the people the words of the Lord and gathered the seventy men of the elders of the people and set them around the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord came down in a cloud, and spoke to him, and took of the Spirit that was on him, and gave it to the seventy elders, and when the Spirit rested on them, they prophesied, but did not do it again.
speaker: Narrator

text: But two men remained in the camp. The name of one was Eldad, and the name of the other, Medad. And the Spirit rested on them. They were among those listed, but they had not gone out to the tent, and so they prophesied in the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a young man ran and told Moses and said, “Eldad and Medad prophesy in the camp.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua the son of Nun, the assistant of Moses from his youth, answered and said, “My lord Moses, forbid them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to him, “Are you jealous for my sake? Oh, that all the people of the Lord were prophets, and that the Lord would put His Spirit upon them!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses returned to the camp, he and the elders of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a wind from the Lord started up, and it swept quail from the sea and let them fall beside the camp, about a day’s journey on this side and a day’s journey on the other side, around the camp, and about two cubits above the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people stayed up all that day, all night, and all the next day, and gathered the quail. Those who gathered least gathered ten homers. And they spread them out for themselves all around the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: While the meat was between their teeth, before it was chewed, the anger of the Lord burned against the people, and the Lord struck the people with a very great slaughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called the name of that place Kibroth Hattaavah because there they buried the people who had the craving.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people journeyed from Kibroth Hattaavah to Hazeroth, and they camped at Hazeroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman whom he married, for he had married a Cushite woman.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “Has the Lord spoken only by Moses? Has He not spoken also by us?” And the Lord heard it.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now the man Moses was very humble, more than all the men on the face of the earth.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke at once to Moses and to Aaron and to Miriam, “Come out, you three, to the tent of meeting.” And those three came out.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord came down in a pillar of cloud, and stood in the opening of the tabernacle, and called Aaron and Miriam, and they both came forward.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He said, “Hear now My word.
If there is a prophet among you,
    I the Lord will make Myself known to him in a vision,
    and I will speak to him in a dream.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Not so with My servant Moses;
    he is entrusted with all My house.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Face to face I speak with him clearly,
    and not in riddles,
    and the likeness of the Lord will he behold.
Then why were you not afraid
    to speak against My servant, against Moses?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the anger of the Lord burned against them, and He set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the cloud went away from over the tabernacle, Miriam became leprous as snow, and Aaron turned toward Miriam and saw that she was leprous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron said to Moses, “Alas, my lord, do not lay the sin on us, which we have done foolishly, and which we have sinned.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not let her be as dead, who when he goes out of his mother’s womb half his flesh is eaten.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses cried out to the Lord, saying, “O God, heal her, I pray!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord said to Moses, “If her father had but spit in her face, would she not be ashamed seven days? Let her be shut out of the camp seven days, and afterward she may be received again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Miriam was shut out from the camp seven days, and the people did not set out until Miriam was brought in again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward the people set out from Hazeroth and camped in the Wilderness of Paran.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Send men that they may explore the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the children of Israel. Of every tribe of their fathers you will send a man, each one a chief among them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses sent them from the Wilderness of Paran according to the Lord. All those men were heads of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These were their names:
of the tribe of Reuben, Shammua the son of Zakkur;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat the son of Hori;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the tribe of Issachar, Igal the son of Joseph;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Nun;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the tribe of Benjamin, Palti the son of Raphu;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel the son of Sodi;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the tribe of Joseph, namely, of the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi the son of Susi;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the tribe of Dan, Ammiel the son of Gemalli;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the tribe of Asher, Sethur the son of Michael;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi the son of Vophsi;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the tribe of Gad, Geuel the son of Maki.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the men whom Moses sent to explore the land. And Moses called Hoshea the son of Nun Joshua.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses sent them to explore the land of Canaan and said to them, “Go up to this southland, and go up into the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And see what the land is, and the people that dwell in it, whether they are strong or weak, few or many;
speaker: Narrator

text: and what the land is that they dwell in, whether it is good or bad, and what cities are that they dwell in, whether in tents, or in fortifications;
speaker: Narrator

text: and what the land is, whether it is fat or lean, whether there is wood in it or not. And you be courageous and bring some of the fruit of the land.” Now the time was the time of the first ripe grapes.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they went up and explored the land from the Wilderness of Zin to Rehob, near Lebo Hamath.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went up by the Negev and came to Hebron where Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the children of Anak, were (now Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt).
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to the Valley of Eshkol, and cut down from there a branch with one cluster of grapes, and they carried it on a pole between two of them, and they brought some of the pomegranates and of the figs.
speaker: Narrator

text: The place was called the Valley of Eshkol because of the cluster of grapes which the children of Israel cut down from there.
speaker: Narrator

text: They returned from exploring the land after forty days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they returned and came to Moses and to Aaron and to all the assembly of the children of Israel, to the Wilderness of Paran, to Kadesh, and brought back word to them and to the entire assembly and showed them the fruit of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: They reported to him and said, “We came to the land where you sent us, and surely it flows with milk and honey, and this is the fruit of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, the people are strong that dwell in the land, and the cities are fortified and very great, and also we saw the children of Anak there.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Amalekites dwell in the land of the Negev, and the Hittites, and the Jebusites, and the Amorites dwell in the mountains, and the Canaanites dwell by the sea and by the edge of the Jordan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Caleb silenced the people before Moses and said, “Let us go up at once and possess it, for we are able to overcome it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the men that went up with him said, “We are not able to go up against the people because they are stronger than we.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave the children of Israel a bad report of the land which they had spied out, saying, “The land through which we have gone as spies is a land that devours its inhabitants, and all the people whom we saw in it are men of great stature.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there we saw the giants, the sons of Anak, which come from the giants, and in our eyes we were like grasshoppers, and so we were in their eyes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the whole assembly lifted up their voices and cried, and the people wept that night.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the children of Israel grumbled against Moses and against Aaron, and the whole assembly said to them, “O that we had died in the land of Egypt! Or that we had died in this wilderness!
speaker: Narrator

text: And why has the Lord brought us to this land to fall by the sword, that our wives and our children should become prey? Is it not better for us to return to Egypt?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said one to another, “Let us select a leader, and let us return to Egypt.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the congregation of the assembly of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua the son of Nun, and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, from the ones who explored the land, tore their clothes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they spoke to all the assembly of the children of Israel, saying, “The land which we passed through to explore it is a very, very good land.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the Lord delights in us, then He will bring us into this land and give it to us, a land which flows with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only do not rebel against the Lord, nor fear the people of the land because they are bread for us. Their defense is gone from them, and the Lord is with us. Do not fear them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But all the assembly said, “Stone them with stones.” And the glory of the Lord appeared at the tent of meeting before all the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “How long will this people disgrace Me? And how long will they not believe Me, in spite of all the signs which I have done among them?
speaker: Narrator

text: I will strike them with the pestilence, and disinherit them, and will make from you a nation greater and mightier than they.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to the Lord, “Then the Egyptians will hear of it, for by Your power You brought this people up from among them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they will say to the inhabitants of this land that they heard that You, Lord, are among this people, that You, Lord, are seen face to face, and Your cloud stands over them, and in the pillar of cloud You go before them by day and by a pillar of fire at night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now if You kill all this people as one man, then the nations which have heard the fame of You will speak, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘The Lord was not able to bring this people into the land which He swore to them, so He slaughtered them in the wilderness.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “So now, I pray, let the power of my Lord be great, just as You have spoken, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘The Lord is slow to anger and abounding in mercy, forgiving iniquity and transgression; but He will by no means clear the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children to the third and fourth generation.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Pardon the iniquity of this people, I pray, according to the greatness of Your grace, just as You have pardoned this people, from Egypt even until now.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said, “I have forgiven according to your word.
speaker: Narrator

text: But truly as I live, all the earth will be filled with the glory of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because all those men seeing My glory and My signs which I did in Egypt and in the wilderness, and have tempted Me now these ten times, and have not listened to My voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: surely they will not see the land which I swore to their fathers, nor will any of them who disgraced Me see it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But My servant Caleb, because he had a different spirit with him and followed Me fully, I will bring him into the land where he went, and his seed will possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites lived in the valley. Tomorrow you will turn, and you will set out for the wilderness by the way of the Red Sea.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: How long will this evil assembly be murmuring against Me? I have heard the murmurings of the children of Israel which they murmur against Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say to them, “As I live,” says the Lord, “just as you have spoken in My ears, so I will do to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this wilderness your corpses will fall, and all who were numbered of you, according to your whole number, from twenty years old and upward, who have murmured against Me,
speaker: Narrator

text: you will not go into the land which I swore by My hand to cause you to dwell in it, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: But your children, whom you said would be a prey, I will bring them in and they will know the land, which you rejected.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, your corpses will fall in this wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your children will be shepherds in the wilderness forty years, and they will suffer for your fornications, until your corpses are in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the number of the days in which you spied out the land, forty days, a year for each day you will bear your iniquity, forty years, and you will know My displeasure.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I the Lord have spoken. I will surely do this to all this evil assembly gathered against Me. In this wilderness they will be finished, and there they will die.
speaker: Narrator

text: The men whom Moses sent to explore the land, who returned and made all the assembly murmur against him by bringing up an evil report about the land,
speaker: Narrator

text: the men who brought an evil report about the land, died by the pestilence before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, from the men that went to explore the land, lived.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses spoke these words to all the children of Israel, and the people mourned greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text: They rose up early in the morning, and they went up to the top of the mountain, saying, “Here we are. We will go up to the place which the Lord has promised, for we have sinned.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said, “Why do you now transgress the commandment of the Lord? This will not prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not go up, for the Lord is not among you; do not let yourselves be defeated by your enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites are there before you, and you will fall by the sword because you are turned from the Lord, and the Lord will not be with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they presumed to go up to the top of the mountain. But the ark of the covenant of the Lord and Moses did not depart from the midst of the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Amalekites and the Canaanites who dwelt on that mountain went down and defeated them, pursuing them as far as Hormah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: When you come into the land of your dwelling, which I am giving to you,
speaker: Narrator

text: when you make an offering by fire to the Lord, a burnt offering, or a sacrifice in performing a vow, or as a freewill offering, or in your appointed feasts, to make a pleasing aroma to the Lord, of the herd or of the flock,
speaker: Narrator

text: then he who brings his offering to the Lord will bring a grain offering of a tenth of an ephah of flour mixed with the fourth part of a hin of oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: One-fourth of a hin of wine as a drink offering you will prepare with the burnt offering or sacrifice, for each lamb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or for a ram, you will make a grain offering of two-tenths of an ephah of flour mixed with one-third of a hin of oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a drink offering you will offer one-third of a hin of wine, as a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you prepare a bull as a burnt offering, or as a sacrifice in performing a vow, or as a peace offering to the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: then shall be brought with the bull a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of flour mixed with one-half a hin of oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will bring as a drink offering one-half a hin of wine, as a fire offering, as a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus it will be done for one herd animal, or for one ram, or for a flock animal, whether from the sheep or from the goats.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the number that you will make, so you will do for every one according to their number.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every native Israelite will do these things in this manner, in offering a fire offering as a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: A foreigner who lives with you, or who resides among you throughout your generations, and would present a fire offering, a pleasing aroma to the Lord, shall do as you do.
speaker: Narrator

text: One ordinance will be for you of the assembly and for the foreigner who lives with you, an ordinance forever throughout your generations. As you are, so will the foreigner be before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: One law and one justice will be for you and for the foreigner who lives with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: When you come into the land where I bring you,
speaker: Narrator

text: then it will be, when you eat of the bread of the land you will offer up an offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the first of your dough you will offer a cake as an offering. As you make the offering of the threshing floor, so will you offer it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the first of your dough you will give to the Lord an offering throughout your generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you have erred and not observed all these commandments which the Lord has spoken to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: even all that the Lord has commanded you by the hand of Moses, from the day that the Lord commanded Moses and onward through your generations,
speaker: Narrator
