text: then it will be, if it is committed by ignorance without the knowledge of the assembly, that all the assembly will offer one young bull as a burnt offering, as a pleasing aroma to the Lord, with its grain offering and its drink offering, according to the rule, and one kid of the goats as a sin offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest will make atonement for all the assembly of the children of Israel, and it will be forgiven them because it is ignorance, and they will bring their offering, a sacrifice made by fire to the Lord, and their sin offering before the Lord, for their ignorance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it will be forgiven all the assembly of the children of Israel and the foreigner who lives among them, because all the people were in ignorance.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a person sins unintentionally, then he will bring a year-old female goat as a sin offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest will make an atonement for the person who sins unintentionally, when he sins by ignorance before the Lord, to make an atonement for him; and it will be forgiven him.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall have one law for the person who acts through ignorance, for the natural-born citizen among the children of Israel and foreigner who lives in your midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the person who acts by a high hand, the natural-born citizen or the foreigner, the same reviles the Lord, and that person will be cut off from among his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because he has despised the word of the Lord and has broken His commandment, that person will be totally cut off. His iniquity will be on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: While the children of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man who gathered sticks on the Sabbath day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ones who found him gathering sticks brought him to Moses and Aaron and to all the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: They put him in confinement because it was not declared what should be done to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “The man will surely die. All the assembly will stone him with stones outside the camp.”
speaker: Narrator

text: All the assembly brought him outside the camp and stoned him with stones, and he died as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them to make for themselves tassels on the corners of their garments throughout the generations to come, and they will put a ribbon of blue on the corners of their garments.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it will be for you a tassel, and you will see it, and you will remember all the commandments of the Lord, and you will do them, and you will not follow the lust of your own heart and your own eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall you remember and do all My commandments, and be holy to your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the Lord your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Korah the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, and Dathan and Abiram the sons of Eliab, and On the son of Peleth, sons of Reuben, took men,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they rose up before Moses and men of the children of Israel, two hundred and fifty chiefs of the assembly, famous in the assembly, well-known men.
speaker: Narrator

text: They assembled against Moses and against Aaron, and said to them, “You take too much upon yourselves, seeing all the congregation are holy, every one of them, and the Lord is among them. So why do you exalt yourselves above the assembly of the Lord?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Moses heard it, he fell on his face,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he spoke to Korah and to all his company, saying, “In the morning the Lord will show who is His and who is holy, and He will bring him to come near to Him. Whom He has chosen He will bring near to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do this: Take censers, Korah and all his company;
speaker: Narrator

text: put fire in them, and put incense in them before the Lord tomorrow, and it will be that the man whom the Lord chooses, he will be holy. You take too much upon yourselves, sons of Levi.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to Korah, “Listen, please, sons of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Does it seem a small thing to you that the God of Israel has separated you from the assembly of Israel to bring you near to Himself to do the service of the tabernacle of the Lord, and to stand before the assembly to minister to them?
speaker: Narrator

text: And He has brought you near to Him, and all your brothers, the sons of Levi, with you, and you also seek the priesthood?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore both you and all your company are gathered together against the Lord, and who is Aaron that you murmur against him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses sent for Dathan and Abiram the sons of Eliab, who said, “We will not come up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is it a small thing that you have brought us up out of a land that flows with milk and honey to kill us in the wilderness because you make yourself a prince over us?
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover you have not brought us into a land that flows with milk and honey nor given us inheritance of fields and vineyards. Will you put out the eyes of these men? We will not come up.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses was very angry and said to the Lord, “Do not respect their offering. I have not taken one donkey from them, nor have I hurt one of them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to Korah, “You and all your company be before the Lord, you and them and Aaron, tomorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let each man take his censer and put incense in it, and each of you bring his censer before the Lord, two hundred and fifty censers. Also you and Aaron shall each bring his censer.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Every man took his censer and put fire in it, and laid incense on it, and stood at the door of the tent of meeting with Moses and Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Korah gathered all the assembly against them to the door of the tent of meeting, and the glory of the Lord appeared to all the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Separate yourselves from among this assembly, that I may consume them in a moment.
speaker: Narrator

text: They fell on their faces and said, “O God, the God of the spirits of all flesh, will one man sin and You will be angry with all the assembly?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak to the assembly, saying: Get up from around the tents of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses rose up and went to Dathan and Abiram, and the elders of Israel followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He spoke to the assembly, saying, “Depart now from the tents of these wicked men, and touch nothing of theirs, lest you be swept away for all their sins.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they got up from the tents of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram, on every side, and Dathan and Abiram came out and stood in the opening of their tents, and their wives, and their sons, and their children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said, “By this you will know that the Lord has sent me to do all these works, because I have not done them of my own mind.
speaker: Narrator

text: If these men die the common death of all men, or if they are visited after the visitation of all men, then the Lord has not sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the Lord makes a new thing, and the earth opens its mouth and swallows them with all that belongs to them, and they go down alive into the pit, then you will know that these men have despised the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So it was, when he finished speaking all these words, that the ground that was under them split open.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them, and their houses, and all the men that belonged to Korah, and all their goods.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they and all that belonged to them went down alive into the pit, and the earth closed on them, and they perished from among the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: All Israel that was around them fled at their cry because they said, “The earth will swallow us also.”
speaker: Narrator

text: A fire went out from the Lord and consumed the two hundred and fifty men that offered incense.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest to take up the censers out of the blaze, for they are holy. Then scatter the fire far and wide.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the censers of these men who have sinned at the cost of their own lives, make them into hammered plates as a covering for the altar, for they presented them before the Lord and they are holy. They shall be a sign to the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Eleazar the priest took the bronze censers, which those who were burned had offered, and they were hammered out as a covering on the altar,
speaker: Narrator

text: to be a memorial to the children of Israel, that no outsider, who is not of the descendants of Aaron, shall approach to offer incense before the Lord, that he might not become like Korah and his company, as the Lord has said to him through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the next day all the assembly of the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron, saying, “You have killed the people of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the assembly was gathered against Moses and Aaron, they looked toward the tent of meeting. The cloud covered it, and the glory of the Lord appeared.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Aaron went before the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Get up from among this assembly, that I may destroy them in a moment.” And they fell on their faces.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to Aaron, “Take a censer and put fire in it from off the altar, and put in incense, and go quickly to the assembly, and make an atonement for them, because wrath has gone out from the Lord. The plague has begun.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron took it as Moses commanded and ran into the midst of the assembly, where the plague had begun among the people. He put in incense and made an atonement for the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: He stood between the dead and the living, and the plague was stopped.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now those who died in the plague were fourteen thousand seven hundred, besides those that died concerning the thing of Korah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron returned to Moses, to the door of the tent of meeting, and the plague was stopped.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak to the children of Israel, and take from them a rod, a rod for the house of their fathers, from all their leaders according to the house of their fathers, twelve rods. Write each man’s name on his rod.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will write the name of Aaron on the rod of Levi, because one rod will be for each father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will lay them in the tent of meeting before the testimony, where I will meet with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: It will be that the rod of the man whom I choose will bud. Thus I will rid myself of the complaints of the children of Israel, that they have been making against you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses spoke to the children of Israel, and each one of their leaders gave him a rod, one for each leader, according to their fathers’ houses, even twelve rods, and the rod of Aaron was among their rods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses laid the rods before the Lord in the tent of witness.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses went into the tent of witness the next day, the rod of Aaron, for the house of Levi, had sprouted. It brought forth buds, produced blossoms, and yielded almonds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses brought out all the rods from before the Lord to all the children of Israel, and they looked, and each man took his rod.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Return the rod of Aaron before the testimony, to be kept for a warning to rebels, that you may put an end to their complaints before Me, or else they will die.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses did so. As the Lord commanded him, so he did.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Israel spoke to Moses, saying, “Behold, we expire, we perish, we all perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Anyone approaching the tabernacle of the Lord will die. Are we all to perish?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to Aaron: You and your sons and your father’s house with you will bear the iniquity of the sanctuary, and you and your sons with you will bear the iniquity of your priesthood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your brothers also of the tribe of Levi, the tribe of your father, bring with you, and let them be joined with you, and minister to you. But you and your sons with you will minister before the tent of witness.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will perform duties for you and for the whole tent; but they will not come near the vessels of the sanctuary or the altar, so that neither they nor you die.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will be joined to you and perform the duties of the tent of meeting, for all the service of the tent; no foreigner will come near you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You yourselves will perform the duties of the sanctuary and the duties of the altar, so that wrath may never come upon the children of Israel again.
speaker: Narrator

text: I Myself have taken your brothers, the Levites, from among the children of Israel; they are given to you as a gift from the Lord to perform the service of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you and your sons with you will attend to your priesthood for everything at the altar, and within the veil, and you will serve. I have given your priesthood to you as a gift service, and the foreigner that comes near will be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Aaron: I have certainly given you the charge of the offerings made to Me, all the hallowed gifts of the children of Israel. To you and to your sons have I given them as a portion, as an ordinance forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: This will be yours of the most holy things, reserved from the fire: All of their offerings, all of their grain offerings and all of their sin offerings, and all of their guilt offerings, which they render to Me, will be most holy for you and for your sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: In a most holy place shall you eat it; every male shall eat it. It shall be holy to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is yours: the offering of their gift, with all the wave offerings of the children of Israel. I have given them to you and to your sons and to your daughters with you, as an eternal statute. Everyone who is clean in your house will eat of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the best of the oil, and all the best of the wine, and of the wheat, the first fruits of what they will offer to the Lord, those have I given to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The first ripe fruit of all which is in their land, which they will bring to the Lord, will be yours. Everyone who is clean in your house will eat of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everything devoted in Israel will be yours.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everything that opens the womb of all flesh, which they bring to the Lord, whether it is of men or animals, will be yours. However, you will surely redeem the firstborn of man, and the firstborn of unclean beasts you will redeem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their redemption price, reckoned from one month of age, is five shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, which is twenty gerahs.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the firstborn of a herd animal, or the firstborn of a sheep, or the firstborn of a goat, you will not redeem. They are holy. You will splash their blood on the altar and will burn their fat as a fire offering, as a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their flesh will be yours, as the wave breast and as the right shoulder are yours.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the offerings of the holy things which the children of Israel offer to the Lord I have given to you, and to your sons and your daughters with you, as an eternal statute. It is a covenant of salt forever before the Lord, to you and to your seed with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Aaron: You will not have an inheritance in their land, nor will you have any territory among them. I am your territory and your inheritance among the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have given the children of Levi all the tithes in Israel for an inheritance, for their service, which they serve, even the service of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hereafter, the children of Israel shall not come near the tent of meeting, lest they bear sin and die.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Levites will do the service of the tent of meeting, and they will bear their iniquity. It will be an eternal statute throughout your generations, that among the children of Israel they have no inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the tithes of the children of Israel, which they offer as an offering to the Lord, I have given to the Levites to inherit. Therefore I have said to them, among the children of Israel they will have no inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: You will speak to the Levites, and say to them: When you take from the children of Israel the tithes that I have given you from them for your inheritance, then you will offer up an offering of it to the Lord, even one-tenth of the tithe.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this offering will be counted to you, as though it was the grain of the threshing floor, and as the fullness of the winepress.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus you also will set apart an offering to the Lord from all the tithes which you receive from the children of Israel. Out of them you will give the offering of the Lord to Aaron the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of all your gifts you shall present every offering due to the Lord, from all the best of them, the consecrated part of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will say to them: When you have offered the best from it, then it will be counted to the Levites as the increase of the threshing floor, and as the increase of the winepress.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will eat it in every place, you and your households, because it is your reward for your service in the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will bear no sin because of it, when you have offered the best of it. The holy things of the children of Israel you will not pollute, and you will not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the statute of the law which the Lord has commanded, saying: Tell the children of Israel that they will bring you a healthy red heifer, which has no blemish, and on which a yoke has never gone,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you will give it to Eleazar the priest, and he will bring it outside the camp, and it will be slaughtered before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Eleazar the priest will take from its blood with his finger and sprinkle some of its blood directly before the tent of meeting seven times.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it will be burned in his sight. Its hide and its flesh and its blood, with her dung, will be burned.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priest will take cedar wood, and hyssop, and scarlet and throw it into the midst of the burning of the heifer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priest will wash his clothes, and he will bathe his body in water, and afterward he will come into the camp, and the priest will be unclean until evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who burns it will wash his clothes in water, and bathe his body in water, and will be unclean until evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man who is clean will gather the ashes of the heifer and deposit them outside the camp in a clean place, and it will be guarded for the assembly of the children of Israel for water of purification. It is for purifying from sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that gathers the ashes of the heifer will wash his clothes and be unclean until evening, and it will be for the children of Israel and for the foreigner that lives among them, for an eternal statute.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that touches the dead body of any man will be unclean seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will make himself clean on the third day, and on the seventh day he will be clean. But if he does not make himself clean on the third day, then the seventh day he will not be clean.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever touches the body of any man that is dead and does not purify himself defiles the tabernacle of the Lord, and that person will be cut off from Israel. Because the water of purification was not sprinkled on him, he will be unclean. His uncleanness is still on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the law, when a man dies in a tent. Each person who comes into the tent and all that is in the tent will be unclean seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every open vessel which has no covering fastened on it is unclean.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever in the field touches one that is slain with a sword, or a dead body, or a bone of a man, or a grave will be unclean seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: For an unclean person they will take from the ashes of the burnt sin offering, and running water will be on it in a vessel.
speaker: Narrator

text: A clean person will take hyssop, and dip it in the water, and splash it on the tent, and on all the vessels, and on the people who were there, and on him that touched a bone, or one slain, or one dead, or a grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: The clean person will splash on the unclean person on the third day and on the seventh day. And on the seventh day he shall purify himself, wash his clothes, and bathe in water; and he will be clean at evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the man who is unclean and does not purify himself, that person will be cut off from among the assembly because he has defiled the sanctuary of the Lord. The water of purification has not been sprinkled on him. He is unclean.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It will be an eternal statute to them.
He that sprinkles the water of purification will wash his clothes, and he that touches the water of purification will be unclean until evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whatever the unclean person touches will be unclean, and the person that touches it will be unclean until evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the children of Israel, the whole assembly, came to the Wilderness of Zin in the first month, and the people dwelt in Kadesh, and Miriam died there and was buried there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was no water for the assembly, and they gathered themselves together against Moses and against Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people argued with Moses, and spoke, saying, “O that we had died when our brothers died before the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: And why have you brought up the assembly of the Lord into this wilderness, that we and our livestock should die here?
speaker: Narrator

text: And why have you brought us up from Egypt, to bring us into this evil place? It is no place of seed, or of figs, or of vines, or of pomegranates. Nor is there any water to drink.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Aaron went from the presence of the assembly to the door of the tent of meeting, and they fell on their faces, and the glory of the Lord appeared to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Take the rod, and gather the assembly together, you and Aaron your brother, and speak to the rock before their eyes, and it will give its water, and you will bring out to them water from the rock; so you will give the assembly and their livestock drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses took the rod from before the Lord, as He commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Aaron gathered the assembly before the rock, and he said to them, “Hear now, you rebels. Will we bring out water from this rock for you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses lifted up his hand, and he struck the rock twice with his rod, and plenty of water came out, and the assembly drank, and their livestock.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, “Because you did not believe in Me, to sanctify Me in the eyes of the children of Israel, therefore you will not bring this assembly into the land which I have given them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the water of Meribah because the children of Israel argued with the Lord, and He was sanctified among them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moses sent messengers from Kadesh to the king of Edom,
“Thus says your brother Israel: You know all the hardship that has found us,
speaker: Narrator

text: how our fathers went down into Egypt, and we lived in Egypt a long time, and the Egyptians distressed us and our fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And when we cried out to the Lord, He heard our voice and sent an angel and brought us out of Egypt.
“And here we are in Kadesh, a city on the edge of your territory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Please let us pass through your land. We will not pass through the fields or the vineyards, or drink of the water of the wells. We will travel the king’s highway. We will not turn to the right hand nor the left, until we have passed through your territory.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Edom said to him,
“You will not pass through me, lest with the sword I come out against you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The children of Israel said to him,
“We will travel the highway, and if we and our livestock drink of your water, then we will pay for it. I will only go through on my feet without doing anything else.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He said,
“You will not go through.”
And Edom came out against them with many people and with a strong hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Edom refused to give Israel passage through his territory, so Israel turned away from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Kadesh, and the children of Israel, even the whole assembly, came to Mount Hor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron in Mount Hor, by the border of the land of Edom, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Aaron will be gathered to his people because he will not enter into the land which I have given to the children of Israel because you rebelled against Me at the water of Meribah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take Aaron and Eleazar his son, and bring them up to Mount Hor,
speaker: Narrator

text: and strip Aaron of his garments, and put them on Eleazar his son, and Aaron will be gathered to his people, and he will die there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses did as the Lord commanded, and they went up onto Mount Hor in the sight of all the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses stripped Aaron of his garments and put them on Eleazar his son. And Aaron died there on the top of the mountain, and Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: When all the assembly saw that Aaron was dead, they wept for Aaron thirty days, all the house of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: When King Arad the Canaanite, who lived in the Negev, heard that Israel came by the way of Atharim, he fought against Israel and took some of them captive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel vowed a vow to the Lord and said, “If You will indeed deliver this people into my hand, then I will utterly destroy their cities.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord listened to the voice of Israel and delivered up the Canaanites, and they utterly destroyed them and their cities, and he called the name of the place Hormah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Mount Hor by the way of the Red Sea, to go around the land of Edom, and the soul of the people was very discouraged because of the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people spoke against God and against Moses, “Why have you brought us up from Egypt to die in the wilderness? For there is no bread or water, and our soul loathes this worthless manna.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord sent poisonous serpents among the people, and they bit the people, and many children of Israel died.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people came to Moses and said, “We have sinned for we have spoken against the Lord and against you. Pray to the Lord, and He will take away the serpents from us.” And Moses prayed for the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Make a poisonous serpent, and put it on a pole, and it will be, that everyone who is bitten, when he looks at it, will live.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses made a bronze serpent and put it on a pole, and if a serpent had bitten any man, when he looked at the bronze serpent he lived.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Israel set out and camped in Oboth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Oboth and camped at Iye Abarim in the wilderness, which is before Moab toward the sunrise.
speaker: Narrator

text: From there they journeyed and camped in the Valley of Zered.
speaker: Narrator

text: From there they journeyed and camped on the other side of Arnon, which is in the wilderness that comes out of the borders of the Amorites, for Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore it is said in the Book of the Wars of the Lord:
“Zahab in Suphah, and in the brooks
of Arnon,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and at the stream of the brooks
that goes down to the dwelling of Ar,
    and lies on the border of Moab.”
speaker: Narrator

text: From there they went to Beer. That is the well of which the Lord spoke to Moses, “Gather the people together, and I will give them water.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Israel sang this song:
“Spring up, O well!
    sing to it—
speaker: Narrator

text:
the leaders dug the well;
    the nobles of the people dug,
    by the lawgiver, with their staffs.”
And from the wilderness they went to Mattanah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and from Mattanah to Nahaliel, and from Nahaliel to Bamoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and from Bamoth in the valley that is in the country of Moab to the top of Pisgah, which looks toward Jeshimon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Let me pass through your land. We will not turn into the fields nor into the vineyards. We will not drink of the waters of the well. But we will go along by the king’s highway until we are past your borders.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Sihon would not allow Israel to pass through his border. But Sihon gathered all his people together and went out against Israel into the wilderness, and he came to Jahaz and fought against Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel defeated him with the edge of the sword and possessed his land from Arnon to Jabbok, all the way to the children of Ammon, because the border of the children of Ammon was strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel took all these cities, and Israel lived in all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon, and in all its villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because Heshbon was the city of Sihon the king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab and taken all his land out of his hand, to Arnon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore they that speak in proverbs say:
“Come into Heshbon; let it be built,
    and let the city of Sihon be established,
speaker: Narrator

text:
because a fire went out of Heshbon,
    a flame from the city of Sihon;
it has devoured Ar of Moab
    and the masters of the high places of Arnon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe to you, Moab!
    You have perished, O people of Chemosh!
He has made his sons fugitives,
    and his daughters captives,
    to Sihon king of the Amorites.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“We have overthrown them;
    Heshbon is perished to Dibon,
and we have desolated them to Nophah,
    which reaches to Medeba.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Israel lived in the land of the Amorites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses sent to spy out Jazer, and they took its villages and drove out the Amorites who were there.
speaker: Narrator

text: They turned and went up by the way of Bashan, and Og the king of Bashan went out against them, he and all his people, to the battle at Edrei.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Do not fear him because into your hand I have given him, and all his people, and his land, and you will do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they killed him, and his sons, and all his people, until there was not a survivor left to him alive, and they possessed his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the children of Israel set out and camped in the plains of Moab on the other side of the Jordan from Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moab was very afraid of the people because they were many, and Moab was distressed because of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moab said to the elders of Midian, “Now this company will lick up all that are around us, as the ox licks up the grass of the field.”
And Balak the son of Zippor was king of the Moabites at that time.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent messengers to Balaam the son of Beor at Pethor, which is by the Euphrates in the land of the sons of his people, to call him, saying,
“A people went out from Egypt. They cover the face of the earth, and they dwell next to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, please come curse this people for me because they are too mighty for me. Perhaps I will prevail, and we will defeat them, and I will drive them out of the land because I know that he whom you bless is blessed, and he whom you curse is cursed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The elders of Moab and the elders of Midian went with the divination payments in their hand, and they came to Balaam and spoke to him the words of Balak.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Lodge here tonight, and I will bring you word again, as the Lord will speak to me.” And the leaders of Moab dwelt with Balaam.
speaker: Narrator

text: God came to Balaam and said, “Who are these men with you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Balaam said to God, “Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, has sent word to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘A people went out of Egypt who covers the face of the earth. Now come, curse them for me. Perhaps I will be able to battle them and drive them out.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: God said to Balaam, “You will not go with them. You will not curse the people because they are blessed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Balaam rose up in the morning and said to the princes of Balak, “Go to your land because the Lord refuses to let me to go with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The princes of Moab rose up, and they went to Balak and said, “Balaam refuses to come with us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again Balak sent officials, more numerous and more honorable than they.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They came to Balaam and said to him,
“Thus says Balak the son of Zippor, ‘Please, let nothing hold you back from coming to me,
speaker: Narrator

text: because I will promote you to very great honor, and anything you say to me I will do. Come please, curse this people for me.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam answered the servants of Balak, “If Balak gave me his house full of silver and gold, I am not able to go beyond the command of the Lord my God, to do less or more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now please remain here tonight, that I may know what more the Lord will say to me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: God came to Balaam at night and said to him, “If the men come to call you, rise up and go with them. But surely the word which I will say to you, that will you do.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam rose up in the morning, and saddled his donkey, and went with the princes of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: The anger of God was inflamed because he went, and the angel of the Lord stood in the way as an adversary against him. Now he was riding on his donkey, and his two servants were with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The donkey saw the angel of the Lord standing in the way, and His sword was drawn in His hand, so the donkey turned out of the way and went into the field. Balaam struck the donkey to turn her onto the road.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the angel of the Lord stood in a narrow path of the vineyards, a wall on this side and a wall on that side.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, she threw herself into the wall and crushed the foot of Balaam against the wall, and he struck her again.
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel of the Lord went further and stood in a narrow place where there was no way to turn either to the right hand or to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, she fell down under Balaam, and the anger of Balaam was inflamed, and he struck the donkey with a staff.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord opened the mouth of the donkey, and she said to Balaam, “What have I done to you, that you have struck me these three times?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Balaam said to the donkey, “You have mocked me. O that there was a sword in my hand, for now I would kill you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The donkey said to Balaam, “Am I not your donkey, whom you have ridden since I became yours, to this day? Do I normally do this to you?”
And he said, “No.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord opened the eyes of Balaam, and he saw the angel of the Lord standing in the way, and His sword was drawn in His hand, and he bowed his head and fell flat on his face.
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel of the Lord said to him, “Why have you struck your donkey these three times? I have come out to oppose you, because your way is perverse before Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the donkey saw Me and turned from Me these three times. If she had not turned from Me, surely by now I would have slain you and saved her alive.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam said to the angel of the Lord, “I have sinned because I did not know that You stood in the way against me. Now therefore, if it displeases You, I will return.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel of the Lord said to Balaam, “Go with the men. But only speak the word that I tell you to speak.” So Balaam went with the leaders of Balak.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Balak heard that Balaam had come, he went out to meet him in a city of Moab which is on the border of Arnon, which is at the furthest end of the border.
speaker: Narrator

text: Balak said to Balaam, “Did I not earnestly send to summon you? Why did you not come to me? Indeed am I not able to honor you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Balaam said to Balak, “I have come to you now. But am I able to speak just anything? The word God puts in my mouth is what I will speak. ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam went with Balak, and they came to Kiriath Huzoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Balak offered oxen and sheep and sent them to Balaam and to the officials who were with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: It came to pass on the next day that Balak took Balaam and brought him up to Bamoth Baal, and from there he saw the extent of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Balaam said to Balak, “Build for me seven altars, and prepare for me seven oxen and seven rams.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balak did as Balaam had spoken, and Balak and Balaam offered on every altar a bull and a ram.
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam said to Balak, “Stand by your burnt offering, and I will go. Perhaps the Lord will come to meet me, and whatever He shows me I will tell you.” And he went to a high place.
speaker: Narrator

text: God met Balaam, and he said to Him, “I have prepared seven altars, and I have offered on every altar a bull and a ram.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord put a word in the mouth of Balaam and said, “Return to Balak, and thus you will speak.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he returned to Balak, who was standing by his burnt offering with all the princes of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Balaam uttered his oracle, saying:
“Balak has brought me from Aram,
    the king of Moab from the mountains of the east,
saying, ‘Come, curse Jacob for me,
    and come, defy Israel!’
speaker: Narrator

text:
How will I curse
    whom God has not cursed?
Or how will I defy
    whom the Lord has not defied?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For from the top of the rocks I see him,
    and from the hills I behold him;
there, the people will dwell alone
    and will not be counted among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can count the dust of Jacob
    and the number of the fourth part of Israel?
Let me die the death of the righteous,
    and let my last end be like his!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? I brought you to curse my enemies, but now you have certainly blessed them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered and said, “Must I not take heed to speak what the Lord puts in my mouth?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Balak said to him, “Please come with me to another place from where you may see them. You will see part of them, but will not see them all. Curse them for me from there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought him into the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to Balak, “Stand here by your burnt offerings while I meet the Lord over there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord met Balaam and put a word in his mouth and said, “Go again to Balak, and thus you will speak.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he came to him, he was standing by his burnt offerings with the princes of Moab. And Balak said to him, “What has the Lord spoken?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And he took up his parable and said:
“Rise up, Balak, and hear!
    Listen to me, you son of Zippor!
speaker: Narrator

text:
God is not a man, that He should lie,
    nor a son of man, that He should repent.
Has He spoken, and will He not do it?
    Or has He spoken, and will He not make it good?
speaker: Narrator

text:
See, I have received a commandment to bless,
    and He has blessed, and I cannot reverse it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“He has not beheld iniquity in Jacob,
    nor has He seen perverseness in Israel.
The Lord his God is with him,
    and the shout of a king is among them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, who brings them out of Egypt,
    has strength like a wild ox.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely there is no enchantment against Jacob,
    nor is there any divination against Israel.
For this time it will be said of Jacob and of Israel,
    ‘See what God has done!’
speaker: Narrator

text:
A people rises up as a great lion,
    and lifts itself up like a lion;
it shall not lie down until it eats the prey
    and drinks the blood of the slain.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balak said to Balaam, “Do not curse them at all, nor bless them at all.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Balaam answered and said to Balak, “Did I not tell you, saying, ‘All that the Lord speaks, I must do’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Balak said to Balaam, “Please come. I will bring you to another place. Perhaps it will please God that you may curse them for me from there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balak brought Balaam to the top of Peor, which looks toward Jeshimon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam said to Balak, “Build for me seven altars, and prepare for me seven bulls and seven rams.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balak did as Balaam said and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Balaam saw that it pleased the Lord to bless Israel, he did not go as other times to seek for enchantments, but he set his face toward the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam lifted up his eyes, and he saw Israel dwelling in their tents by their tribes, and the Spirit of God came on him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He took up his proverb and said:
“Balaam the son of Beor has said,
    and the man whose eyes are open has said,
speaker: Narrator

text:
he has said, who heard the words of God,
    who saw the vision of the Almighty,
    falling into a trance, but having his eyes open:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“How lovely are your tents, O Jacob,
    and your tabernacles, O Israel!
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Like palm trees are they spread out,
    like gardens by the river’s side,
like the aloe plant, which the Lord has planted,
    and like cedar trees beside the waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will pour the water out of his buckets,
    and his seed will be in many waters. 
“His king will be higher than Agag,
    and his kingdom will be exalted.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He crouches, he lies down as a lion, and as a lion,
    who will stir him up? 
“Blessed is he who blesses you,
and cursed is he who curses you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The anger of Balak was inflamed against Balaam, and he struck his hands together. And Balak said to Balaam, “I called you to curse my enemies, and indeed, you have certainly blessed them these three times.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now flee to your own place. I thought to promote you to great honor. But certainly, the Lord has kept you back from honor.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam said to Balak, “Did I not speak to your messengers which you sent to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the mouth of the Lord, to do either good or bad of my own mind. But what the Lord speaks, I will speak’?
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, I am going to my people. Come, I will advise you what this people will do to your people in the latter days.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
the oracle of the one hearing the words of God,
    and knowing the knowledge of the Most High,
who sees the vision of the Almighty,
    falling into a trance, but having his eyes open:
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Edom will be a possession,
    and Seir, a possession of its enemies,
    while Israel does valiantly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One out of Jacob shall have dominion,
    and destroy the survivors of the city.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then he looked on Amalek; he took up his proverb and said:
“Amalek was the first of the nations,
    but his end will be that he perishes forever.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
nevertheless the Kenite will be wasted.
    How long until Ashur carries you away captive?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He took up his proverb and said:
“Alas, who will live when God does this?
speaker: Narrator

text:
And ships will come from the coasts of Cyprus
and will afflict Ashur and will afflict Eber,
    and he also will perish forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam rose up and went and returned to his place, and Balak also went his way.
speaker: Narrator

text: While Israel dwelt in Shittim, the people began to commit harlotry with the women of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: They called the people to the sacrifices of their gods, and the people ate and bowed down to their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel joined himself to the Baal of Peor, and the anger of the Lord was inflamed against Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Take all the chiefs of the people and hang them before the Lord in the sun, that the fierce anger of the Lord turn from Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to the judges of Israel, “Kill each of the men who have aligned themselves with the Baal of Peor.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, one of the children of Israel came and brought to his brothers a Midianite woman in the sight of Moses and in the sight of all the assembly of the children of Israel, who were weeping before the door of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw it, he rose up from among the assembly and took a spear in his hand,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he went after the man of Israel into the tent, and thrust both of them through, the man of Israel and the woman through her belly. So the plague was stopped from the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those that died in the plague were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, has turned My wrath away from the children of Israel, because he was zealous for My sake among them, so I did not exterminate the children of Israel in My zeal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore say, ‘I hereby grant him My covenant of peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it will be for him and his seed after him, even the covenant of an everlasting priesthood, because he was zealous for his God and made an atonement for the children of Israel.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the name of the slain Israelite who was slain with the Midianite woman was Zimri the son of Salu, a leader of a chief house among the Simeonites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The name of the Midianite woman that was slain was Kozbi the daughter of Zur. He was chief over a people and of a father’s house in Midian.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Be hostile to the Midianites, and defeat them,
speaker: Narrator

text: because they have been hostile to you with their wiles, with which they have deceived you in the matter of Peor and in the matter of Kozbi the daughter of a leader of Midian, their sister, who was slain on the day of the plague because of Peor.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After the plague, the Lord spoke to Moses and to Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take the count of all the assembly of the children of Israel from twenty years old and older, throughout their fathers’ houses, all that are able to go to war in Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Eleazar the priest spoke with them in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Take the count of the people from twenty years old and older,” as the Lord commanded Moses.
The children of Israel, who went out of the land of Egypt, were these:
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites;
of Karmi, the family of the Karmites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of the Reubenites: those who were counted were forty-three thousand seven hundred and thirty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Pallu was Eliab.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Eliab were Nemuel, and Dathan, and Abiram. This is that Dathan and Abiram, called out from the assembly, who argued against Moses and against Aaron in the company of Korah when they argued against the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them with Korah when that company died, when the fire devoured two hundred and fifty men, and they became a sign.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the children of Korah did not die.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
of Zerah, the family of the Zerahites;
of Shaul, the family of the Shaulites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of the Simeonites: twenty-two thousand two hundred.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
of Ozni, the family of the Oznites;
of Eri, the family of the Erites;
speaker: Narrator

text:
of Arodi, the family of the Arodites;
of Areli, the family of the Arelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of the children of Gad according to those by their count: forty thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Judah were Er and Onan, and Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text: These are the families of Judah by their count: seventy-six thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
of Jashub, the family of the Jashubites;
of Shimron, the family of the Shimronites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of Issachar by their count: sixty-four thousand three hundred.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: These are the families of the Zebulunites by their count: sixty thousand five hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Joseph according to their families, by Manasseh and Ephraim, were:
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
and of Asriel, the family of the Asrielites;
and of Shechem, the family of the Shechemites;
speaker: Narrator

text:
and of Shemida, the family of the Shemidaites;
and of Hepher, the family of the Hepherites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zelophehad the son of Hepher had no sons, but daughters, and the names of the daughters of Zelophehad were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milkah, and Tirzah.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of Manasseh, and those who were numbered of them were fifty-two thousand seven hundred.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
These are the sons of Shuthelah:
of Eran, the family of the Eranites.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These are the families of the sons of Ephraim by their count: thirty-two thousand five hundred.
These are the sons of Joseph by their families.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
of Shupham, the family of the Shuphamites;
of Hupham, the family of the Huphamites.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: These are the sons of Benjamin by their families, and by their count: forty-five thousand six hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These are the sons of Dan according to their families:
of Shuham, the family of the Shuhamites.
These are the families of Dan after their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the families of the Shuhamites, by their count, were sixty-four thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text: The name of the daughter of Asher was Serah.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of the sons of Asher by their count: fifty-three thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
of Jezer, the family of the Jezerites;
of Shillem, the family of the Shillemites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of Naphtali according to their families; those who were numbered of them were forty-five thousand four hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the counted of the children of Israel: six hundred and one thousand, seven hundred and thirty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: To these the land will be divided for an inheritance by the number of names.
speaker: Narrator

text: To a large tribe you shall give a large inheritance, and to small tribe you shall give a small inheritance. To each one his inheritance will be given according to those who were numbered of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the land will be divided by lot. By the names of the tribes of their fathers they will inherit.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the lot his possession will be divided between large and small.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
These are the families of the Levites:
the family of the Libnites,
the family of the Hebronites,
the family of the Mahlites,
the family of the Mushites,
the family of the Korahites.
And Kohath begot Amram.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the name of the wife of Amram was Jochebed, the daughter of Levi, whom her mother bore to Levi in Egypt, and she bore to Amram Aaron and Moses and Miriam their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Aaron was born Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nadab and Abihu died when they offered foreign fire before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were numbered of them were twenty-three thousand, each male from a month old and older; for they were not counted among the children of Israel, because there was no inheritance given them among the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were counted by Moses and Eleazar the priest, who counted the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: But among these there was not a man counted by Moses and Aaron the priest when they counted the children of Israel in the Wilderness of Sinai
speaker: Narrator

text: because the Lord had said of them, “They will surely die in the wilderness.” And there was not a man left of them, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came near the daughters of Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Makir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of Manasseh the son of Joseph, and these are the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milkah, and Tirzah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stood before Moses, and before Eleazar the priest, and before the leaders and all the assembly by the door of the tent of meeting, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Our father died in the wilderness, and he was not in the company of them that gathered against the Lord, in the company of Korah, but died in his own sin and had no sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why should the name of our father diminish from among his family, because he has no son? Give to us a possession among the brothers of our father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses brought their case before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: The daughters of Zelophehad speak right. You will certainly give them an inheritance among their father’s brothers, and you will cause the inheritance of their father to pass on to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will speak to the children of Israel, saying, “If a man dies, and has no son, then you will cause his inheritance to pass on to his daughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he has no daughter, then you will give his inheritance to his brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he has no brothers, then you will give his inheritance to his father’s brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: If his father has no brothers, then you will give his inheritance to his closest kinsman in his family, and he will possess it. And it will be for the children of Israel a statute of judgment, as the Lord commanded Moses.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Go up into this mountain of Abarim, and see the land which I have given to the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you have seen it, you also will be gathered to your people as Aaron your brother was gathered.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you rebelled against My commandment in the Wilderness of Zin when the congregation argued against Me. You did not show My holiness at the waters before their eyes.” (These are the waters of Meribah in Kadesh in the Wilderness of Zin.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses spoke to the Lord, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Let the Lord, the God of the spirits of all flesh, appoint a man over the assembly
speaker: Narrator

text: who will go out before them, and who will go in before them, and who will lead them out, and who will bring them in, so the assembly of the Lord will not be like sheep who do not have a shepherd.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Take Joshua the son of Nun, a man in whom is the Spirit, and lay your hand on him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and cause him to stand before Eleazar the priest and before all the assembly, and command in their sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will put some of your majesty on him, in order that all the assembly of the children of Israel will listen.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will stand before Eleazar the priest, who will ask for him about the judgment of the Urim before the Lord. At his word will they go out, and at his word they will come in, both he and all the children of Israel with him, even all the assembly.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses did as the Lord commanded him, and he took Joshua, and he caused him to stand before Eleazar the priest and before all the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he laid his hands on him and commanded him as the Lord spoke by the hand of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Command the children of Israel and say to them: My offering, My bread for My sacrifices made by fire, as a pleasing aroma to Me, you will guard to offer to Me at their time.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will say to them: This is the fire offering which you will bring near to the Lord: two male lambs in their first year, without blemish, day by day, as a regular burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one lamb you will offer in the morning, and the other lamb you will offer at evening,
speaker: Narrator

text: and one-tenth of an ephah of flour as a grain offering, mingled with one-fourth of a hin of beaten oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a regular burnt offering, which was ordained at Mount Sinai as a pleasing aroma, a sacrifice made by fire to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its drink offering will be one-fourth of a hin for the one lamb. In a holy place you will pour the strong wine to the Lord as a drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The other lamb you will offer at evening. As the morning grain offering and its drink offering, you will offer it as an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the Sabbath day two lambs in their first year, without blemish, and two-tenths of an ephah of flour as a grain offering, mixed with oil, and its drink offering—
speaker: Narrator

text: this is the burnt offering of every Sabbath, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the beginnings of your months you will offer a burnt offering to the Lord: two young bulls, one ram, seven lambs in their first year, without blemish;
speaker: Narrator

text: three-tenths of an ephah of flour as a grain offering, mixed with oil, for one bull; and two-tenths of an ephah of flour as a grain offering, mixed with oil, for one ram;
speaker: Narrator

text: and one-tenth of an ephah of flour mixed with oil as a grain offering for one lamb; as a burnt offering of a pleasing aroma, a sacrifice made by fire to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their drink offerings will be one-half a hin of wine for a bull, and one-third of a hin for a ram, and one-fourth of a hin for a lamb. This is the burnt offering of each month throughout the months of the year.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also one male goat as a sin offering to the Lord shall be offered, besides the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the fourteenth day of the first month is the Passover of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the fifteenth day of this month is the feast. Unleavened bread will be eaten for seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the first day there will be a holy convocation. You will not do any ordinary work,
speaker: Narrator

text: but you will offer a sacrifice made by fire as a burnt offering to the Lord: two young bulls, and one ram, and seven lambs in their first year. Be sure they are without blemish.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their grain offering will be of flour mixed with oil. Three-tenths of an ephah you will offer for a bull, and two-tenths of an ephah for a ram.
speaker: Narrator

text: One-tenth of an ephah you will offer for each of the seven lambs,
speaker: Narrator

text: and one goat as a sin offering, to make an atonement for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will offer these in addition to the burnt offering in the morning, which is for a regular burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The same way you will offer daily, throughout the seven days, the food of the sacrifice made by fire, as a pleasing aroma to the Lord. It will be offered in addition to the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the seventh day you will have a holy assembly. You will not do any ordinary work.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the day of the first fruits, when you bring a new grain offering to the Lord at your Feast of Weeks, you will have a holy assembly. You will do no ordinary work.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you will offer the burnt offering as a pleasing aroma to the Lord: two young bulls, one ram, and seven lambs in their first year;
speaker: Narrator

text: and their grain offering of flour mixed with oil, three-tenths of an ephah for one bull, two-tenths of an ephah for one ram,
speaker: Narrator

text: one-tenth of an ephah for each of the seven lambs;
speaker: Narrator

text: and one goat, to make an atonement for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make sure they are without blemish. You will offer them with their drink offerings, besides the regular burnt offering and its grain offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you will have a holy assembly. You will do no ordinary work. It is a day of blowing the trumpets for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will offer a burnt offering as a pleasing aroma to the Lord: one young bull, one ram, and seven lambs in their first year, without blemish;
speaker: Narrator

text: their grain offering will be of flour mixed with oil, three-tenths of an ephah for a bull, and two-tenths of an ephah for a ram,
speaker: Narrator

text: and one-tenth of an ephah for one lamb, for the seven lambs;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one goat as a sin offering, to make an atonement for you;
speaker: Narrator

text: besides the burnt offering of the month and its grain offering, and the daily burnt offering and its grain offering, and their drink offerings, according to their rule, as a pleasing aroma, a sacrifice made by fire to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will have a holy assembly on the tenth day of this seventh month, and you will afflict yourselves. You will not do any work on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you will offer a burnt offering to the Lord as a pleasing aroma: one young bull, one ram, and seven lambs in their first year. Be sure they are without blemish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their grain offering will be of flour mixed with oil, three-tenths of an ephah for the bull, and two-tenths of an ephah for one ram,
speaker: Narrator

text: and one-tenth of an ephah for each of the seven lambs;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one goat as a sin offering in addition to the sin offering of atonement, and the regular burnt offering, and its grain offering, and their drink offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the fifteenth day of the seventh month you will have a holy convocation. You will do no ordinary work, and you will keep a feast to the Lord seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will offer a burnt offering, a sacrifice made by fire, as a pleasing aroma to the Lord: thirteen young bulls, two rams, and fourteen lambs in their first year, without blemish.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their grain offering will be of flour mixed with oil, three-tenths of an ephah to a bull, and two-tenths of an ephah to each ram of the two rams,
speaker: Narrator

text: and one-tenth to each lamb of the fourteen lambs;
speaker: Narrator

text: and one goat as a sin offering in addition to the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the second day present twelve young bulls, two rams, fourteen lambs in their first year without blemish,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their grain offering and their drink offerings, for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number according to the ordinance;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one goat as a sin offering, besides the regular burnt offering, and its grain offering, and their drink offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the third day present eleven bulls, two rams, fourteen lambs in their first year without blemish,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their grain offering and their drink offerings, for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number according to the ordinance;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one goat as a sin offering, besides the regular burnt offering, and its grain offering, and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the fourth day present ten bulls, two rams, and fourteen lambs in their first year without blemish,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their grain offering and their drink offerings, for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number according to the ordinance;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one goat as a sin offering in addition to the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the fifth day present nine bulls, two rams, and fourteen lambs in their first year without blemish,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their grain offering and their drink offerings, for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number according to the ordinance;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one goat as a sin offering in addition to the regular burnt offering, and its grain offering, and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the sixth day present eight bulls, two rams, and fourteen lambs in their first year without blemish,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their grain offering and their drink offerings, for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number according to the ordinance;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one goat as a sin offering in addition to the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the seventh day present seven bulls, two rams, and fourteen lambs in their first year without blemish,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their grain offering and their drink offerings, for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number according to the ordinance;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one goat as a sin offering in addition to the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the eighth day you will have a solemn assembly. You will do no ordinary work on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you will offer a burnt offering, a sacrifice made by fire as a pleasing aroma to the Lord: one bull, one ram, seven lambs in their first year, without blemish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their grain offering and their drink offerings, for the bull, for the ram, and for the lambs, will be according to their number, according to the rule;
speaker: Narrator

text: also one goat as a sin offering in addition to the regular burnt offering, and its grain offering, and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things you will do to the Lord in your set feasts in addition to your vows and your freewill offerings, as your burnt offerings, and as your grain offerings, and as your drink offerings, and as your peace offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses told the children of Israel everything, according to all that the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses spoke to the heads of the tribes of the children of Israel, saying: This is the thing that the Lord has commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man vows a vow to the Lord, or swears an oath to bind himself with a bond, he will not break his word. He will do according to all that proceeds out of his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a woman makes a vow to the Lord, and binds herself by a bond, while in her father’s house in her youth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and her father hears her vow and her bond with which she has bound herself, and her father is silent to her, then all her vows will stand, and every bond with which she has bound herself will stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if her father restrains her in the day he hears, none of her vows or her bonds with which she has bound herself will stand, and the Lord will forgive her, because her father restrained her.
speaker: Narrator

text: If she had a husband when she vowed, or uttered anything out of her lips with which she bound herself,
speaker: Narrator

text: and her husband heard it and was silent to her in the day that he heard it, then her vows will stand, and her bonds with which she bound herself will stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if her husband restrains her on the day that he heard it, then he will make her vow which she vowed and that which she uttered with her lips, with which she bound herself, of no effect, and the Lord will forgive her.
speaker: Narrator

text: But every vow of a widow and of her that is divorced, with which she has bound herself, will stand against her.
speaker: Narrator

text: If she vowed in her husband’s house, or bound herself by a bond with an oath,
speaker: Narrator

text: and her husband heard it and was silent to her and did not restrain her, then all her vows will stand, and every bond with which she bound herself will stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if her husband has clearly voided them on the day he heard them, then whatever proceeded out of her lips concerning her vows, or concerning the bond of herself, will not stand. Her husband has voided them, and the Lord will forgive her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every vow, and every binding oath to afflict her soul, her husband may establish, or her husband may nullify.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if her husband says nothing to her from day to day, then he confirms all her vows, or all her pledges, which bind her. He confirms them because he said nothing to her on the day that he heard them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if he clearly makes them void after he has heard them, then he will bear her iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the statutes which the Lord commanded Moses, between a man and his wife, and between the father and his daughter, while she is still young and in her father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Avenge the children of Israel on the Midianites. Afterward you will be gathered to your people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses spoke to the people, saying, “Arm some of your men for war, and let them go against the Midianites to give the vengeance of the Lord against Midian.
speaker: Narrator

text: A thousand from each tribe, throughout all the tribes of Israel, you will send to the war.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So there were delivered from the thousands of Israel a thousand of each tribe, twelve thousand armed for war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses sent them to the war, a thousand from each tribe, with Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, with the holy vessels and the trumpets to sound the alarm in his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: They waged war against the Midianites, as the Lord commanded Moses, and they killed every male.
speaker: Narrator

text: They killed the kings of Midian, in addition to the rest of those who were killed: Evi, and Rekem, and Zur, and Hur, and Reba, five kings of Midian. Balaam the son of Beor they also killed with the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Israel returned with the women of Midian and their children and took their livestock, and all their flocks, and all their wealth for plunder.
speaker: Narrator

text: They burned with fire all their cities in which they lived and all their camps.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took all the plunder and all the prey of men and of beasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the captives, the prey, and the plunder to Moses, to Eleazar the priest, to the assembly of the children of Israel, and to the camp on the plains of Moab, which are by Jordan across from Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Eleazar the priest and all the leaders of the assembly went to meet them outside the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses was angry with the officers of the army, with the captains over thousands, and captains over hundreds, who came from the battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to them, “Have you saved all the women alive?
speaker: Narrator

text: These caused the children of Israel, through the word of Balaam, to act unfaithfully against the Lord concerning the thing of Peor, and there was a plague among the assembly of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So now kill every male among the little ones, and kill every woman who has known a man by lying with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But keep alive for yourselves all the young girls who have not known a man by lying with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you stay outside the camp seven days. Whoever has killed any person and whoever has touched any slain, purify both yourselves and your captives on the third day and on the seventh day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Purify all your clothes, and all that is made of skins, and all work of goats’ hair, and all things made of wood.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar the priest said to the fighting men of Israel who went to the battle, “This is the ordinance of the law which the Lord commanded Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the gold, and the silver, the bronze, the iron, the tin, and the lead,
speaker: Narrator

text: everything that can go through the fire, you will make it go through the fire, and it will be clean, but some of it will be purified with the water of purification, and all that cannot pass through the fire you will make go through the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will wash your clothes on the seventh day, and you will be clean, and afterward you will come into the camp.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take the count of the plunder that was taken, of man and of beast, you and Eleazar the priest, and the chief of the fathers of the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And divide the prey into two parts between those that took the war on themselves, who went out to battle, and between all the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And levy a tribute to the Lord from the fighting men of Israel who went out to battle: one person out of five hundred, of the people and of the oxen, and of the donkeys, and of the sheep;
speaker: Narrator

text: take it from their half, and give it to Eleazar the priest as an offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the half of the children of Israel, you will take one portion of fifty, of the people, of the oxen, of the donkeys, and of the flocks, of all manner of beasts, and give them to the Levites, who keep the guard of the tabernacle of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The plunder, being the rest of the prey, which the fighting men of Israel had caught, was six hundred and seventy-five thousand sheep,
speaker: Narrator

text: seventy-two thousand oxen,
speaker: Narrator

text: and sixty-one thousand donkeys,
speaker: Narrator

text: and thirty-two thousand people in all, of women who had not known a man by lying with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The half, which was the portion of those that went out to war, was three hundred and thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord’s tribute of the sheep was six hundred and seventy-five.
speaker: Narrator

text: The oxen were thirty-six thousand, of which the Lord’s tribute was seventy-two.
speaker: Narrator

text: The donkeys were thirty thousand five hundred, of which the Lord’s tribute was sixty-one.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people were sixteen thousand, of which the Lord’s tribute was thirty-two people.
speaker: Narrator
