text: Moses gave the tribute which was the Lord’s offering to Eleazar the priest, as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the half of the children of Israel, which Moses divided from the men who fought,
speaker: Narrator

text: the half belonging to the assembly was three hundred and thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep,
speaker: Narrator

text: thirty-six thousand oxen,
speaker: Narrator

text: thirty thousand five hundred donkeys,
speaker: Narrator

text: and sixteen thousand people.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the half of the children of Israel Moses took one out of fifty, of man and of beast, and gave them to the Levites, who kept the guard of the tabernacle of the Lord, as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The officers who were over thousands of the army, the captains of thousands, and captains of hundreds, came near to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they said to Moses, “Your servants have taken the count of the fighting men of Israel who are in our hand, and not a man of us is missing.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have brought an offering for the Lord, what every man has gotten of jewels of gold, chains, and bracelets, rings, earrings, and pendants, to make an atonement for ourselves before the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold from them, all in the form of fashioned articles.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the gold of the offering that they offered up to the Lord, of the captains of thousands and of the captains of hundreds, was sixteen thousand seven hundred and fifty shekels.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fighting men of Israel had taken plunder, each man for himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold of the captains of thousands and of hundreds and brought it into the tent of meeting as a memorial for the children of Israel before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the children of Reuben and the children of Gad had a very great number of livestock, and when they saw the land of Jazer and the land of Gilead was a place for livestock,
speaker: Narrator

text: the children of Gad and the children of Reuben came and spoke to Moses, and to Eleazar the priest, and to the leaders of the assembly, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Ataroth, and Dibon, and Jazer, and Nimrah, and Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Sebam, and Nebo, and Beon,
speaker: Narrator

text: the land which the Lord defeated before the assembly of Israel is a land for livestock, and your servants have livestock.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, “If we have found mercy in your sight, let this land be given to your servants for a possession, and do not take us over the Jordan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to the children of Gad and to the children of Reuben, “Will your brothers go to war, and you will dwell here?
speaker: Narrator

text: And why would you discourage the hearts of the children of Israel from going over into the land which the Lord has given to them?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus your fathers did, when I sent them from Kadesh Barnea to see the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they went up to the Valley of Eshkol and saw the land, they discouraged the hearts of the children of Israel so they would not go into the land which the Lord had given them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the anger of the Lord was inflamed on that day, and He swore, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Surely none of the men who came up out of Egypt, from twenty years old and older, will see the ground which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, because they did not completely follow Me,
speaker: Narrator

text: except Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, and Joshua the son of Nun, because they completely followed the Lord.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The anger of the Lord was inflamed against Israel, and He made them wander in the wilderness forty years, until all the generation that did evil in the eyes of the Lord was finished.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Behold, you have risen up in your fathers’ place, an increase of sinful men, to increase more the burning anger of the Lord toward Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you turn away from following Him, He will again abandon them in the wilderness, and you will destroy all this people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They approached him and said, “We will build sheepfolds here for our livestock and cities for our children.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we ourselves will be armed, ready before the children of Israel, until we have brought them to their place. Our little ones will dwell in the fortified cities because of the inhabitants of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will not return to our houses until all the children of Israel have inherited their inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will not inherit with them on the other side of the Jordan or beyond, because our inheritance fell to us on this side of the Jordan to the east.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to them, “If you will do this thing, if you will be armed before the Lord for war,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all of you, each armed, will go over the Jordan before the Lord until He has driven out His enemies from before Him
speaker: Narrator

text: and the land is subdued before the Lord, then after that you will return and be exempt before the Lord and before Israel, and this land will be your possession before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But if you will not do so, you have sinned against the Lord, and be sure your sin will find you out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Build for yourselves cities for your children and folds for your sheep, and do that which has proceeded out of your mouth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Gad and the children of Reuben spoke to Moses, saying, “Your servants will do as my lord commands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our children, our wives, our flocks, and all our livestock will be there in the cities of Gilead,
speaker: Narrator

text: but your servants will cross over, each man armed for war, before the Lord to battle, as my lord says.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses commanded Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun, and the chief fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said to them, “If the children of Gad and the children of Reuben will cross over the Jordan with you, each man armed for battle before the Lord, and the land will be subdued before you, you are to give them the land of Gilead as a possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if they do not cross over with you armed, they will have possessions among you in the land of Canaan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Gad and the children of Reuben answered, saying, “As the Lord has said to your servants, so we will do.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will cross over, armed before the Lord into the land of Canaan, so the possession of our inheritance on this side of the Jordan may be ours.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses gave to the children of Gad, to the children of Reuben, and to half the tribe of Manasseh the son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, the land with the cities within the borders, the cities of the surrounding land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Gad built Dibon and Ataroth and Aroer,
speaker: Narrator

text: Atroth Shophan and Jazer and Jogbehah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beth Nimrah and Beth Haran, fortified cities, and folds for sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Reuben built Heshbon and Elealeh and Kiriathaim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nebo and Baal Meon (their names being changed) and Sibmah; and they named the other cities which they built.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Makir the son of Manasseh went to Gilead and captured it and drove out the Amorites who were in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses gave Gilead to Makir the son of Manasseh, and he lived in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jair the son of Manasseh went and captured its small towns and called them Havvoth Jair.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nobah went and captured Kenath and its villages and called it Nobah, after his own name.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the journeys of the children of Israel, who went out of the land of Egypt with their armies under the hand of Moses and Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses recorded the starting points of their journeys at the command of the Lord. These are their journeys according to their starting points.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month. On the day after the Passover the children of Israel went out with a high hand in the sight of all the Egyptians,
speaker: Narrator

text: because the Egyptians buried all their firstborn, whom the Lord had killed among them. Upon their gods the Lord executed judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Israel set out from Rameses and camped in Sukkoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Sukkoth and camped in Etham, which is on the edge of the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Etham and turned to Pi Hahiroth, which is before Baal Zephon, and they camped before Migdol.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from before Pi Hahiroth, and passed through the midst of the sea into the wilderness, and went three days’ journey in the Wilderness of Etham, and camped in Marah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Marah, and came to Elim, and in Elim were twelve fountains of water and seventy palm trees, and they camped there.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Elim and camped by the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from the Red Sea and camped in the Wilderness of Sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from the Wilderness of Sin and camped in Dophkah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Dophkah and camped in Alush.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Alush and camped at Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Rephidim and camped in the Wilderness of Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from the Wilderness of Sinai and camped at Kibroth Hattaavah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Kibroth Hattaavah and camped at Hazeroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Hazeroth and camped in Rithmah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Rithmah and camped at Rimmon Perez.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Rimmon Perez and camped in Libnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Libnah and camped at Rissah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Rissah and camped in Kehelathah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Kehelathah and camped at Mount Shepher.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Mount Shepher and camped in Haradah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Haradah and camped in Makheloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Makheloth and camped at Tahath.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Tahath and camped at Terah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Terah and camped in Mithkah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went from Mithkah and camped in Hashmonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Hashmonah and camped at Moseroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Moseroth and camped in Bene Jaakan.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Bene Jaakan and camped at Hor Haggidgad.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Hor Haggidgad and camped in Jotbathah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Jotbathah and camped at Abronah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Abronah and camped at Ezion Geber.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Ezion Geber and camped in the Wilderness of Zin, which is Kadesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Kadesh and camped at Mount Hor, at the edge of the land of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron the priest went up onto Mount Hor at the word of the Lord and died there in the fortieth year after the children of Israel came out of the land of Egypt, in the first day of the fifth month.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron was one hundred and twenty-three years old when he died on Mount Hor.
speaker: Narrator

text: King Arad the Canaanite, who lived in the south in the land of Canaan, heard of the coming of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Mount Hor and camped in Zalmonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Zalmonah and camped in Punon.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Punon and camped in Oboth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Oboth and camped in Iye Abarim, on the border of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Iye Abarim and camped in Dibon Gad.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Dibon Gad and camped in Almon Diblathaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Almon Diblathaim and camped in the mountains of Abarim, before Nebo.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from the mountains of Abarim and camped in the plains of Moab near Jordan of Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: They camped by Jordan, from Beth Jeshimoth to Abel Shittim in the plains of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: When you are crossing over Jordan into the land of Canaan,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you will drive out all the inhabitants of the land from before you, and destroy all their carved images, and destroy all their molded images, and destroy all their high places,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you will drive out the inhabitants of the land and dwell in it, because I have given you the land to inherit it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will possess the land by lot for an inheritance among your families, and to the larger you will give the larger inheritance, and to the smaller you will give the smaller inheritance. Every man’s inheritance will be in the place where his lot falls. By the tribes of your fathers you will inherit.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land from before you, then those whom you let remain will be like thorns in your eyes and thorns in your sides. They will show hostility to you in the land in which you live.
speaker: Narrator

text: And what I had planned to do to them, I will do to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Command the children of Israel, and say to them: When you are going into the land of Canaan, this is the land that will fall to you for an inheritance, the land of Canaan with its borders.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then your south side will be from the Wilderness of Zin along by the border of Edom, and your south border will be the end of the Dead Sea to the east.
speaker: Narrator

text: And your border will turn from the south to the Ascent of Akrabbim, and continue to Zin, and the end of it will be from the south to Kadesh Barnea. Then it will continue to Hazar Addar, and pass on to Azmon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the border will circle around from Azmon to the Brook of Egypt, and the end of it will be at the Mediterranean Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the western border, you will have the Mediterranean Sea and its coastline. This will be your western border.
speaker: Narrator

text: This will be your northern border: From the Mediterranean Sea you will mark a line to Mount Hor;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Mount Hor you will mark a line of your border to Lebo Hamath, and the limits of the border will be to Zedad.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the border will go on to Ziphron, and the limits of it will be at Hazar Enan. This will be your northern border.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will mark a line for your eastern border from Hazar Enan to Shepham.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the border will go down from Shepham to Riblah, on the east side of Ain, and the border will go down and will reach the side of the Sea of Kinnereth to the east.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the border will go down to the Jordan, and the limits of it will be at the Dead Sea.
This will be your land with its borders all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses commanded the children of Israel, saying: This is the land which you will possess by lot, which the Lord commanded to give to the nine tribes, and to the half-tribe
speaker: Narrator

text: because the tribe of the children of Reuben by the house of their fathers and the tribe of the children of Gad by the house of their fathers have received their inheritance, and half the tribe of Manasseh has received their inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: The two tribes and the half-tribe have received their inheritance on this side of the Jordan near Jericho to the east, toward the sunrise.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the men who will divide the land for you: Eleazar the priest and Joshua the son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will take one leader of each tribe to divide the land by inheritance.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
of the tribe of the children of Simeon,
Shemuel the son of Ammihud;
speaker: Narrator

text:
of the tribe of Benjamin,
Elidad the son of Kislon;
speaker: Narrator

text:
the leader of the tribe of the children of Dan,
Bukki the son of Jogli;
speaker: Narrator

text:
the leader of the children of Joseph, for the tribe of the children of Manasseh,
Hanniel the son of Ephod;
speaker: Narrator

text:
the leader of the tribe of the children of Ephraim,
Kemuel the son of Shiphtan;
speaker: Narrator

text:
the leader of the tribe of the children of Zebulun,
Elizaphan the son of Parnak;
speaker: Narrator

text:
the leader of the tribe of the children of Issachar,
Paltiel the son of Azzan;
speaker: Narrator

text:
the leader of the tribe of the children of Asher,
Ahihud the son of Shelomi;
speaker: Narrator

text:
the leader of the tribe of the children of Naphtali,
Pedahel the son of Ammihud.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the ones whom the Lord commanded to divide the inheritance among the children of Israel in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Command the children of Israel, and they will give to the Levites of the inheritance of their possession cities to dwell in, and you will give the Levites pasturelands around the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities will be for them to dwell in, and their pasturelands will be for their livestock, and for their property, and for all their animals.
speaker: Narrator

text: The pasturelands of the cities, which you will give to the Levites, will reach from the wall of the city and beyond one thousand cubits all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will measure from without the city on the east side two thousand cubits, and on the south side two thousand cubits, and on the west side two thousand cubits, and on the north side two thousand cubits, and the city will be in the middle. This will be for them the pasturelands of the cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Among the cities which you will give to the Levites there will be six cities of refuge, which you will appoint for the manslayer, that he may flee there, and to them you will add forty-two cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the cities which you will give to the Levites will be forty-eight cities. You will give them with their pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities which you shall give shall be from the possession of the children of Israel. From the larger tribes you shall give many, and from the smaller tribes you shall give few. Each tribe, in proportion to the inheritance that it receives, shall give of its cities to the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak to the children of Israel and say to them: When you are crossing over the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall designate cities as your cities of refuge, so that a manslayer who unintentionally kills a person may flee there.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities will be for you a refuge from the avenger, so that the manslayer does not die until he stands trial before the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities which you designate shall be your six cities of refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will give three cities across the Jordan, and three cities you will give in the land of Canaan, which will be cities of refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the children of Israel, and for the stranger, and for the foreign sojourner among them will be six cities. These will be for a refuge. Everyone that unintentionally kills any person may flee there.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he strikes him with an instrument of iron, so that he dies, he is a murderer. The murderer shall surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he strikes him with a stone in hand, by which he could die, and he dies, he is a murderer. The murderer shall surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or if he strikes him with a weapon of wood in hand, by which he could die, and he dies, he is a murderer. The murderer shall surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The avenger of blood himself will slay the murderer. When he meets him, he will slay him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if he pushed him out of hatred, or threw something at him, lying in wait, so he dies,
speaker: Narrator

text: or in hatred struck him with his hand, so he died, he that struck him shall surely be put to death, because he is a murderer. The avenger of blood will slay the murderer when he meets him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if he pushed him suddenly without hatred, or threw anything at him without lying in wait,
speaker: Narrator

text: or used a stone that may cause death, unintentionally throwing it at him, resulting in death, though they were not enemies, and was not trying to harm him,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the assembly will judge between the manslayer and the avenger of blood according to these judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the assembly will deliver the manslayer out of the hand of the avenger of blood, and the assembly will restore him to the city of his refuge where he fled, and he will dwell in it until the death of the high priest, who was anointed with the holy oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the manslayer will go out at any time beyond the border of the city of his refuge where he fled,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the avenger of blood finds him outside the borders of the city of his refuge, and the avenger of blood kills the manslayer, he will not be guilty of blood,
speaker: Narrator

text: because the manslayer should have remained in the city of his refuge until the death of the high priest. But after the death of the high priest the manslayer may return to the land of his possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: So these things will be for a statute of judgment to you throughout your generations in all your dwelling places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever kills a person, the murderer will be put to death by the testimony of witnesses, but one witness will not testify against a person for death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will not take a ransom for the life of a murderer who is guilty of death, but he will surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will not take a ransom for him who fled to the city of his refuge, that he should come out again to dwell in the land, until the death of the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you will not defile the land which you are in, because blood defiles the land, and the land cannot be cleansed of the blood that is shed in it, except by the blood of him that shed it.
speaker: Narrator

text: So do not defile the land which you are dwelling in, where I am residing, because I the Lord am residing among the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the chief fathers of the families of the children of Gilead the son of Makir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, came near, and spoke before Moses and before the leaders, the chief fathers of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, “The Lord commanded my lord to give the land for an inheritance by lot to the children of Israel, and my lord was commanded by the Lord to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother to his daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: If they are married to any of the sons of the other tribes of the children of Israel, then their inheritance will be taken from the inheritance of our fathers and will be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they are married, so will it be taken from the lot of our inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the jubilee of the children of Israel happens, then their inheritance will be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they are married, so their inheritance will be taken away from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses commanded the children of Israel according to the word of the Lord, saying: “The tribe of the sons of Joseph has spoken right.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the thing which the Lord commands concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, saying, ‘Let them marry whom they think best. But they may marry only within a clan of their father’s tribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the inheritance of the children of Israel will not turn from tribe to tribe, because every one of the children of Israel will keep the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every daughter that possesses an inheritance in any tribe of the children of Israel will be wife to one of the families of the tribe of her father, so every man of the children of Israel may enjoy the inheritance of his fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus no inheritance will turn from one tribe to another tribe, but every tribe of the children of Israel will keep its own inheritance.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as the Lord commanded Moses, thus the daughters of Zelophehad did,
speaker: Narrator

text: for Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milkah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, were married to their uncles’ sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were married into the families of the sons of Manasseh the son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in the tribe of the family of their father.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the commandments and the judgments which the Lord commanded by the hand of Moses to the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho.
speaker: Narrator
